results.description:
Let's take an hour-long, $20 cruise from lower Manhattan to two uncrowded, picturesque beaches near the Queens-Brooklyn border: Riis Park and Fort Tilden, where we'll walk the shore and view the dunes and shrub forest. We'll see abandoned fortresses and bunkers, and bask in the tranquility of this otherworldly environment, a renowned refuge for shore birds and free spirits. We'll stop on the beach for a leisurely rest, snack, or swim. Time and energy permitting, we'll visit the new Brooklyn Bazaar at the recently renovated bathhouses. We'll return by taking a bus from either Riis (near the boat landing) or the far side of the Gil Hodges bridge; the bus will take us to the 2,3 train at Brooklyn College. But you can return by boat for an extra charge (see below).


SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS: Don't be late, or you may not secure a spot on the boat. Bring lunch, which will start at around 12:45 PM, plus a snack for later in the day if you wish. Buy a boat ticket before getting on line no later than 11 AM. (The boat leaves at 11:30.) We won't be able to all stand together on line. So we'll meet on the boat or the Riis Park dock. Also, we will avoid the areas containing poison ivy and dog ticks. That will allow you to wear shorts or a bathing suit if you wish. 

DISTANCE: About 3.5 to 4 miles if you catch the bus at Riis, 5 miles if you catch it across the bridge.

ENDING TIME: We should reach the subway between 5 and 6 PM, depending on whether take the bus at Riis or across the bridge. But you can leave earlier if you buy a roundtrip boat ticket and catch the 3:00 or 5:30 boat--or if you take the bus (near the boat dock) and 2,3 train back, or walk about 45 minutes along picturesque streets to the A train. 


COST: $20 for boat ride ($30 round trip if you decide to leave early and take the boat back) plus $2 for me, in part to cover Meetup's recently increased organizer fee.

TRANSPORTATION: Best: 2 or 3 train to Wall St. Second best: 4 or 5 train to Wall St. Either way, walk east toward South Street at the East River. For details consult tripplanner.mta.info, hopstop.com (which won't include weekend changes), or both, since each is occasionally inaccurate. Also consult http://web.mta.info/weekender.html for weekend changes on your trains.

WAITING LIST:  Sign up and be patient--there will be many cancellations, especially on the morning of the walk. If you're in the top 20 on the list (shown below the main list on the right side of this page on a computer,  not an app) at any time before the walk starts you can come. But please be considerate to others wishing to go: Sign up only if you truly plan to attend, not just as a placeholder in case nothing better turns up. If you can't come, there's no need to let me know. But please change your RSVP online, which may be possible only on a computer.
results.how_to_find_us: From the subway, walk east to South St, then turn right. I'll be on the line at Pier 11, wearing a red cap. (But we won't all be able to stand in line together.) We'll assemble on the dock at Riis Park.
results.name: Boat ride and beach/dune/bridge walk: Riis Park & Ft. Tilden

results.description:
Waiting List: The day before an event we tend to have people drop out so do not be discouraged if you're on the waiting list--there's a good chance you'll be able to join.


 Attending List: Please remember that the RSVP list closes at 5pm the day before an event. If you change your RSVP to NO after that time or are a no-show, someone on the waiting list could be left out. We take that very seriously.

 Club Hours: Gotham Archery has reserved space for us from 11:00am to 1:00pm. Those are the official club hours. Everyone is free to stay longer at the regular range rate.

Afters: There's a great little bistro, Pure Bistro, that we like very much for lunch. Please join us. Check out Pure Bistro at Yelp here: http://www.yelp.com/biz /pure-bistro-brooklyn.

First-Timers: If it is your first time at Gotham Archery, you will have to take a safety & intro lesson class from the range staff and demonstrate safe shooting. No exceptions. Please arrive 15 minutes early; the class will start promptly at 11:00am.

Public Transportation: Gotham Archery is located at 480 Baltic St (Brooklyn, NY 11217) in Gowanus. It's a few blocks south-west of the Atlantic Av-Barclays Ctr train station. The 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, B, D, N, Q and R trains all stop there.

For LIers, take any line in (Port Jeff, Babylon, Ronkonkoma, etc.), but buy your ticket from there to Atlantic Terminal. Change at Jamaica for Atlantic Terminal. Gotham's a 10-15 minute walk down Atlantic Ave., six blocks south. Also, check your local train stations: parking in the garages and lots is usual free on Saturday.

Parkways and Expressways: LIers can come by car (free parking near Gotham is surprisingly gettable),  but taking the BQE or the Jackie Robinson (traffic, congestion, frustration, etc.) is no fun.  

Range Costs: Make sure to mention when you pay for range time you are shooting with the NYC Archery Group to get the CLUB ONLY rate: $20 for two hours of shooting, $5 for equipment (plus sales tax). These discounts only apply during official club hours.

Club Equipment: We DO have club equipment for Gotham, courtesy of Eddie Eng, one of our members, who has kindly donated 4 recurves, three of which are r/h and one l/h. Note: If you have trouble pulling more than 20 pounds, then PLEASE don't ask us to bring one of our club bows, all of which are 24 pound draw strength or higher. 

Per club regulations, all equipment is lent to members on a first-come, first-served basis. We will be happy to accommodate guests of members if there is equipment to lend.

See you on the shooting line!
results.name: Gotham Archery Monthly MeetUp

results.description:
Howdy Benders!  Hope your week is productive.  Sending out a reminder about our session this Saturday same time same place. As the weather changes, it is the perfect opportunity to drag yourself out of bed and unto your yoga mat. When I first wake up and my bed feels so good I have trouble getting out of bed. But then I remember how stressful by my work week was and how imperative yoga is to detoxing my body and aligning my mind and spirit. We owe it to ourselves to feel great! Start investing in yourself by treating yourself right. I can't tell you how many times I didn't feel like doing yoga but how great I felt afterwards.

Think about how you have an opportunity to do yoga in a community setting, meet like-minded people, and support a local business at the same time!

I would like to continue the yoga and would love to see more benders. Please take advantage of this opportunity because it may not be here for long. See you on Saturday. Namaste.

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting with other students
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the the

MindBodyOnline

account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on your

MindBodyOnline

account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show.  I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the

MindBodyOnline

account to allow others to join in on that time slot.



WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

• Permit Disclosure: WE HAVE A PERMIT.

• BRING A WHITE SHIRT AND A DARK SHIRT

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- David T. )

(Co-Leader- Jefferson)

• PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY TO START ON TIME !! Game starts when we have at least 10 players.

Rules explained at the game.

Be Positive - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than you yelling at me and complaining during the game.


Be Safe - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

Be 2! - Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Be Generous! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

• Minimum 10 RSVPs needed for game. Games will be canceled if this number is not reached 1 hour before Game Time (not meetup time).

If the game is canceled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

results.description:
WALK & TALK en español!

Join us for our 'Walk and Talk' guided tour! This is a great opportunity to practice Spanish, learn about the history of New York City, have lots of fun and meet like-minded amigos. We will meet at Father Demo Square, a triangle park with a beautiful fountain centerpiece and benches. The group will first refuel at a veteran coffee seller and learn about different types of brews from Latin America and other parts of the world. From there we will make out way over to a beautiful community garden and then the group will set out for Pablo Picasso’s Bust of Sylvette, a 60-ton, 36-foot-tall concrete sculpture. Afterwards, the group will head to a tapas café for the best tapas in town.

WHO: Anybody interested in Hispanic culture in Nueva York
WHEN: Saturday, August 1, 2015 (Rain date: Saturday, August 8th)
TIME: 11:30pm – 2:30pm
WHY: To hang out, learn more about Hispanic language and culture in the city
LEVEL: Anybody who is at least a Lower Beginner
HOW MUCH:  GRATIS!!! (It does NOT include food.)

Allá nos vemos!

Jorge
results.name: WALK & TALK: Greenwich Village, Soho + Picasso's Sculpture + Tapas

results.description:
This month we'll discuss "The Scold's Bridle" by Minette Walters. "The Scold's Bridle" is a crime novel which won a CWA Gold Dagger. A 'scold's bridle' is a rusted cage built with tongue clamps which was used as a torture device throughout the middle ages.


The meeting will be hosted by Wendy at her house in White Plains. We will provide stuffed burgers. Please bring fruit salad, vegetables, potato salad, macaroni salad, appetizers, drinks or desserts. Let everyone know what you will be bringing by commenting on this meeting.

Some people were not available on 7/25 and some were not available on 8/1 so we did a poll deciding to choose majority vote.  The majority came in favor of 8/1.  I apologize to all of you who cannot make 8/1 and hope to see you next month.

Looking forward to seeing everyone on Saturday, 8/1/2015 at 11:30a.
results.name: Let's discuss "The Scold's Bridle" by Minette Walters

results.description:
This is a introductory improv class taught Saturday 12pm-2pm.  In the future, I hope to teach it on Sundays from 12pm-3pm.  

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

There is no charge for the class.  If you do enjoy the class, there is a suggested donation of $10 or whatever you feel comfortable with giving, as I do expend fees for the cost of the room rental, website, and Meetup group fees.   If I'm able to recuperate most of my costs, I will try to keep the class free.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

results.description:
Andrew Haner, principal of sun|tect: architecture and LEED Accredited Professional, will conduct an afternoon intensive discussing basic green design concepts, LEED credit categories, and new points of emphasis in LEED version 4. 

Free to register! 

The workshop could be useful to those either pursuing a LEED Green Associate credential or simply wishing to learn some basic concepts on green design. Workshop will consist of 5 hourly lectures with breaks for discussion and networking.

Note on LEED (Leadership in Energy + Environmental Design): LEED is an internationally recognized rating system that acts as an industry leader is setting green design standards for the built environment. This lecture's intended audience can vary from interested community member who wishes to know a little more about the built environment to someone who is beginning their studies to take the LEED Green Associate exam and wishes to use this as a additional resource in their own course of study and preparation.

Civic Art Lab is a community storefront in Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn, developed in collaboration with the Bridge Street Development Corporation’s Pop-up Program. This environmental, arts, and educational initiative calls on citizens to co-produce creative and open ways to share skills and showcase recent cultural and environmental initiatives happening locally in order to amplify the diverse voices and encourage future civic engagement.

results.description:
course on a

If you are an international artists or creative professional wanting to work in the US, this online Meetup is for you. This Meetup is intended for international creative professional looking to work in the US as freelancers.

CONTEMPORARY ART PRACTICE is an organization that develops tools and resources to support artists and creative professionals develop strong and successful careers.

This Meetup is structure to be a free 1 hour online info session followed by a 2 hours course.

During the info session you will learn:

1. What is an O1 visa? (also known as "Artist Visa")

2. Who is eligible for an O1 visa

3. What documents you need to apply

4. How much does it cost

5. How long does it take to put together

6. How can you build a good case for your application

If after the info session you decide you want to know more, you can stay for our following 2 hour course. We will cover:

1. How to find a sponsor

2. How to reach for recommenders

3. How to write letters of recommendation to fit USCIS requirements

4. How to organize your evidences and build categories

5. How to know if you need a consultation letter from the union related to your field

6. How to find employers

7. How to organize your itinerary

8. What is a deal memo and how it should look like

9. How to organize yourself to get it done as fast and painless as possible

We will dedicate the last half and hour for Q&A so you get clear about all your concerns and questions about this process.

Maximum of 7 people per course.

The first 1 hour info session is Free and the cost of the following course is $250 per person.

You will leave with an action plan under your arm and vast knowledge on how to tackle every task of your application process. You will also have access to an archive of samples of letters of recommendation, deal memo, itineraries and other useful sources to make this process easier and build a strong case for your O1 visa application.

Join us for this Meetup! You will get very valuable information and you will get to meet people to support you along the process.

Special discounts: You can get a 10% if you pay before the day of the course (message us for paying details). Also, if you bring a friend to the course, you get 10% discount for you and 10% for your friend. Also, you organize a group of 5 people and you get the course for FREE!

Can't make it to this date? We teach this course every other Saturday and we also provide one-on-one courses in New York and Online. Visit our website for more details.
results.name: O1 Visa: Working Visa for Artists and Creative Professionals Course in Brooklyn

results.description:
Fajing literally means to ‘emit strength’. In this school, we focus in ‘whole-body strength emission’. In the area of self-defense, this is of major importance, since one wants to hit an attacker as hard and as fast as possible, and incapacitate him/her within three seconds, in order to save our lives; while maintaining internal equanimity and control. However, most people respond to life-threatening attacks with only the strength of their arms or legs, as opposed to the strength of their whole bodies. Therefore, our responses to attacks are significantly hampered, and our chances of survival get drastically minimized.

Erle Montaigue’s Fajing Quan System of Fighting and Healing is the system of training created by Erle Montaigue, the founder of the World Taiji Boxing Association, in order to develop true whole-body fajing, the method of movement through which we engage every joint in our body in perfect coordination in an explosive manner, delivering full-body strikes into our opponent (think about how much you weigh, as opposed to only the weight of your arm or your leg). 

This desired response is achieved by accessing our reptilian brain, which has been sophisticated through one’s training, and operate from it in the event of an attack, as opposed to operate from our cerebral cortex/human brain, which processes information slower by trying to understand logically what is happening. Our reptilian brain acts only on reflexes, which are deeply engrained in our nervous system; so our training will come out just as another learnt reflex, like muscle memory.

This ability to fajing will be useful also in the healing arts, by emitting healing energy through the same method, in a soft, non-explosive way (Yin-Yang uses of a core, unique principle).

The training consist on:

- 8 Wudang Stepping Methods

- 12 Wudang Hand Weapons Drills

- Small San Sau Self-Defense Form

- One Hand Yang Style Martial Push Hands

- Entering Methods

- Internal and External Mechanics for Striking/Kicking/Punching

- Wudang Knife Forms

- Introduction to Dim Mak

results.name: WTBA's Fajing Quan - Erle Montaigue's System of Fighting and Healing

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
** This class is for anyone who is completely new to improv and have been afraid to try it out. **

** You're welcome to stay and watch the Level 2 class that's happening right after this class ends. **

Public speaking is a powerful skill to have. And there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play.

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

Anyone and everyone is welcome! 

--------------------------------------------------------------------

About Dewey Chaffee

Dewey has more than 20 years of improvisation experience. He spent 23 years perfecting his skills as an improv performer for the Walt Disney Company. He's also appeared on Nickelodeon Television and worked as their audience warm up guy for several seasons of tv production.

Currently, he and his husband perform a live improvised comedy drag show, while at the same time, Dewey is taping his weekly MNN cable talk show, "The Midnight Kiki."
results.name: Intro to Improv [LEVEL 1]

Taking influences from European and African roots, the movement is a synthesis of Contemporary dance, Hip hop culture and African rhythms.Each class will be explored in depth to enhance and develop the dancers fluidity, physical awareness and a true passion to perform.The work will allow you to improve creative and technical skills with live rhythmic music ; performing exuberant floorwork through to vigorous dance movements, ensuring that the dancers leave a signature spatial mark. 

Poundo’s class encourages dancers to approach the movement with technic, fluidity, risk, weight, respiration and athleticism. While pushing the boundaries of the body, we’ll be using the technique paths to explore new ways to move through emotional and organic intentions.

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

Join New York Adventure Club and tour guide Jonathan Anderson as we explore the wonderful history of Coney Island’s amusement zone; a story of crime, passion, and fire that will change the way you see the People’s Playground.

On this tour, we will explore the amusement area of Coney Island from the time of Sodom by the sea, to the Nickel Empire, to the men and women working today to preserve Coney’s amazing history. Along the way, you'll hear about prostitutes living in a giant tin elephant, the invention of the hot dog, and stories about one of the most terrifying rides in amusement park history!

After the tour, we'll finish at a local eatery for some food and drinks!

The NYSC invites you to join us in this rare and unique time of the year where we will celebrate the Blue Moon. Through our Women’s circle we invite you to honor your feelings, honor your soul and call upon your divine being to help you move through this sacred time. 

Within the circle, women unite to empower their voices, enhance their courage, reinforce their compassion, and connect with their wisdom. We meditate, play music to access our heart's knowledge, remember our mothers and grandmas, share, and enjoy sisterhood! This circle is open to all traditions and levels, and beginners are especially encouraged to attend. 
Please arrive on time and bring water to drink, a drum or rattle (you may borrow one at the event), pen & notepad, a scarf, and feel free to bring objects that are connected to your spiritual power.

Suggested donation: $20

For more info visit http://www.nyshamaniccircle.org/womens-circle or email [masked] with questions.

If you need to contact me on Saturday, please feel free to call me at 201/[masked], Karen.

"When women gather, Pachamama heals!"

results.description:
Koah-Bao (刈包) a.k.a. Bao, or more precisely, Steamed Sandwich, has been a notorious snack food of Taiwanese night markets. And as you can see within a Bao, is usually soy sauce roasted pork, some peanuts, chilli sauce and pickles. 

Eddie Huang, a celebrity American Taiwanese chef, food critic and somewhat fashion police, opened up Baohaus in 2011, a restaurant that serves modern Baos. Under the strong influence in Eddie's food personality, Baohaus steps out of street food traditions and re-invents Koah Bao to cater for the mouths of NYC.

Let's start from another Bao restaurant (C Bao) first, then marathon to Baohaus for Eddie's Bao. 

Note: If someone knows another good Bao place in Manhattan, please share it with us as we will make that the 3rd spot!

results.description:
EXPERIENCE THE POWER WITHIN YOU!


Take A Hypnotic Trance Session with Qesankh Maa Kheperu

Change Your Life Forever!

Many of us face challenges in our lives. These challenges come in many forms and what is a challenge for one is not an issue for another. So everyone is unique and comes with their own set of experiences. But there are universal issues that we all face.  The principal ones are money, love, weight, health, and career. We are raised to believe that the way to face these challenges is through hard work and a little knowledge. But nothing could be further from the truth. This is because success is not a set formula that anyone can follow. Everyone must take their own path to getting what they want and there is no one-size-fits-all template to success.

Yet one thing is clear. Many go their entire lives working hard, waiting for their ships to come in yet with no or limited success.  Even worse, some seem to be magnets for money and success in life without putting in a hard day’s work.  But why? Is the universe unfair? On the contrary, there is rhyme and reason to the madness. First off, you must understand that to overcome challenges in your life you have to get right to the source. Unfortunately, our society is caught up in verbal trickery. What I mean by that is that many come along with PHDs at the end of their names and try to address your issues through a verbal discourse in the hope that through deductive reasoning you will come to an understanding of what is the root cause of your plight. Millions of dollars are spent on this type of discredited Freudian treatment.

But how many have been told to stop smoking, stop over-eating, stop taking drugs, stop dating that selfish person, yet they continue to do so knowing full well that what awaits them is likely to be pain and suffering. This is because verbal communication cannot change behavior no matter how passionate you are. How many preachers and ministers whose faith seems unbreakable are caught with their pants down in some type of indiscretion?

Let us examine slavery for example. Many of the chief architects of this horrible atrocity were Christians, Muslims and Catholics. But if they were holy men and women how could they have endorsed the capture and enslavement of an entire continent of people? This is because their religions relied on sermons and verbal language through scriptures as a means to try and spiritually uplift people. This simply does not work. Our ancient ancestors knew this simple truth. This is why most indigenous cultures practiced meditation and trance induction as a means to communicate directly with the subconscious mind, which is the seat of your power.  Now many are turning to hypnotherapy to control their weight, stop smoking or drug-taking, and to relieve pain from surgery or relationships.  These therapists and patients have finally realized that the power to effect change lies not in the conscious mind but rather the subconscious mind. We must realize that the conscious mind can only execute what the subconscious mind directs it to.  The effectiveness of this type of treatment has been proven in many scientific papers and studies. Yet still to this day many are unaware of the success rate of techniques such as hypnotherapy and trance induction. This is because those in control, the global elite, have imprisoned our minds in left brain externalized thinking.

HYPNOTHERAPY MADE A TERRIBLE MISTAKE


Although it’s on the cutting edge of mind therapy, hypnotherapists have made a critical error. They have treated the subconscious mind like a computer. Their psychology being what you put in is what you get out. This is untrue and demonstrates a true gap in their understanding of men and women. It was our ancient so-called primitive ancestors who referred to the subconscious mind as “the spirit” or “the indwelling intelligence”.  They knew early on that the subconscious was consciousness and was intelligent. Hence it is omnipresent and omniscient.  This indwelling intelligence doesn’t just serve to direct the conscious mind based on commands you program into it, this intelligence is responsible for everything that happens to you in the physical world. It creates the very reality you see before you.

This means it plays an active role in your life and is not just relegated to dreams, nightmares and subconscious thoughts and traumas. It is what some in the new age movement call your higher mind. It is all-knowing and connected to everything we experience.  If fact, there really is only one consciousness that we all share.  But we erroneously believe there is a division within consciousness. There is only division within our physical bodies, which separate us on this planet.

Treating the indwelling intelligence within you like a dumb computer that can only be programmed to accomplish the task it is given is to severely limit the power it can accomplish for you. Yes, it’s true you must either program it or command it to perform a task but because it is a super-intelligence it is one thousand steps ahead of your perception. In fact, when you are born it is already aware of your destiny and aligns circumstance to allow you to fulfill the objective of your new incarnation. If you do not program it, it will proceed on its own and lay the foundations for either your success or failure.  But in reality there is no failure, only experience, so what appears to you as a futile attempt is a great experience for the intelligence within. Remember, its goal is to experience reality based on the destiny you have agreed to prior to coming to this physical plane of existence.  So as it sees it there are no good or bad experiences, only information to help it grow in understanding. But this is a discussion for another time; for now we want to focus on empowering you.

YOUR SUFFERING IS A NEEDLESS ACT


We are taught that suffering is a natural part of life. In essence, no pain no gain. That we have to go through emotional ups and downs, pain and pleasure.  In most cases when adversities befall those who have tried to live a righteous life we are told that God will right the wrong done in his own time. Yet, we are never told the entire truth; that pain and pleasure are emotional states that can be triggered at will.  We simply, as a society, are ignorant of the fact that we, not some outside entity, have the ability to remove any physical or emotional pain troubling us. And also, that if needed we can summon such pleasure that it surpasses that of any drug.  These are techniques that can be learned by anyone!

Let’s look at the implications here so we can see a real picture of how society has screwed up our thinking and belief system:

·  A young man becomes addicted to drugs. His addiction causes him to lose his job, friends and the love of family members. He takes to stealing to support his habit. The urge for cocaine is so strong that he simply cannot resist it. In our society he is labeled a drug addict and ostracized. If he is lucky and not arrested for carrying the drugs he may go into a good and expensive treatment center, where they will talk him through a 12 step program.

·  A young woman suffers from poor grades in school. She tries just as hard as everyone else but can’t seem to keep up. Many of the subjects she studies are very intense such as biomechanics requiring many hours of study and research. She fails her final term paper and is forced to repeat the class. If she decides to seek help they will assign her a study buddy who will spend countless hours with her in the library coaching her through the dense material.  Her career is on the line and she must somehow pass this class while not neglecting her other classes.

·  A young man is motivated to start his own business. So he pays thousands of dollars to attend motivational seminars, business lectures and purchases all kinds of at-home programs on how to get rich. Yet, hard as he tries each business is a dismal failure.  He becomes more and more disenchanted. He watches TV or the internet and sees the success others are having and comes to the conclusion that he is just a failure in life.  Once more he dreams of meeting big investors who will fund his business. But he knows he has no such contacts in his Rolodex. He gets a regular 9 to 5 and calls it a life.

·  A man is physically abusive to his wife and daughter. He seeks help to manage his temper and the psychologist traces it back to when he was a child. They discover that he was physically abused by his father and neglected by his mother. In fact, as a child he was sent to the hospital a number of times for broken bones and open wounds inflicted by the violence. The psychologist uses talk therapy to help him realize the origin and resolution to his difficulties. But the man still has occasions or bouts of anger so he takes it one day at a time.

·  A violin player finds herself spending countless hours and thousands of dollars on training. She enjoys the music and the instrument. Through the tried and true practice of repetition she practices the same songs and notes over and over again until she has blisters on her fingers. She even forks over her life savings to hire one of the best violin coaches in the country. She dreams of being in the London Symphony Orchestra or perhaps being solo as a world-renowned player. But she knows full well that it may take years for her to get to master the instrument. And worse, she may discover that she just doesn’t have the talent for it and will have to make a decision to move on with her life. She fears being a housewife or working for corporate America. But the truth is the odds are not in her favor given the current paradigm of society and its failure on how to teach people to awaken their inborn talents. 

·  An aspiring actress looking for her big break attends casting call after casting call but doesn’t land that big role. She pays for acting classes and attends seminars on how to make it in Hollywood. She even moves to California and gets a job as a waitress so that she can have flexible hours and attend her auditions.  But the years pass and yet still no roles. Even worse with each audition she attends she is told she is not the right type. She is too old, too fat, too skinny, too short, too tall, too blonde, too ethnic looking, etc. All of this rejection takes a toll on her mindset. Where she was once a positive individual with hopes of movie fame she now realizes that success in acting eludes her. She gives up and gets a regular job, family and settles down to a normal life.

·  An attractive woman is plagued by relationship issues. She dates different guys looking for her soul mate but there seems to be no chemistry with these men.  Even worse, the guys are jerks, self centered and egotistical. She desires someone to compliment her and daydreams of the perfect mate and children. She realizes that her clock is ticking but there seems to be little that she can do. The club and bar scene is unrewarding as it only results in guys looking for one night stands. So too is the internet. She tries dating sites but the guys hype up their profile and are just looking for one thing. She has even prayed to God to help find her a good man but to no avail. She ends up becoming bitter and disenchanted. Finally, she adopts the belief that love is a myth.

·  A martial artist puts in hundred of hours of practice. She loves to spar and often travels the country competing in competitions. But she has reached a plateau and can’t seem to advance to the next level.  So she increases her efforts but can’t seem to perfect her kicks or her form. She looks around at other martial artists who perform their fights with ease, never forgetting one step. She notes that they are bigger and stronger than her and wonders if she’ll ever be at their skill level. She knows in her heart she has the fire of a lioness but something is holding her back.  Her 5th degree instructor just yells at her telling her to push, push, push! But the more she pushes herself the fewer results she sees. So she resigns herself to the fact that she just doesn’t have the natural ability that other martial artists possess.

·  A young woman finds herself in a terrible position. Everything she eats no matter how little increases her weight. She looks in the mirror and realizes she is severely overweight. However, she can’t stop eating. So in an attempt to handle the situation she tries several fad diets. At first she loses some weight, which makes her feel good. However, in almost no time she regains the weight again and her self-image and self-confidence plummet. Even worse she realizes that when she goes out with her girlfriends guys no longer approach her. She tries diet pills but they don’t work either. Finally, she takes out a gym membership but finds it hard to make the time to go to the gym after work. She knows that being overweight is a health risk but she feels there is nothing she can do. She wants to accept the notion that big is beautiful and accept her full-figured self. However, she often spends Friday and Saturday night at home in deep depression.

As you can clearly see all of the case studies above have two things in common: the reliance on verbal communication to get a person to change his or her behavior, and the dependence on physical means to address their problems. If one were to examine the statistics we would see that such treatments are a dismal failure. But then one may ask why is it that some people have effectively quit smoking, shed weight or stopped drinking? Is this not proof that verbal talk does work?  No, this is because the emotion and desire to change in those individuals penetrated the conscious mind and tapped directly into the subconscious mind effecting true change thus manifesting their desires.  But not everyone has the knowledge to be able to do this nor are people aware enough to be able to reproduce the formula or effects. In religious circles this change is often mislabeled as being born again or God saved me. In secular circles it is attributed to a person’s own drive to change all the while never realizing that the change came after they bypassed the conscious mind to communicate and commanded the subconscious mind to make the radical transformation.  What folks failed to realize is that the power was always within them and the reliance on outside entities such as pills, gurus and books only served to make things more difficult.

Now what I am advocating here is by no means a quick fix. But it is a lot easier than spending hundreds of hours and thousands of dollars trying to overcome a bad habit, emotional issue or learn something new. What we teach is so powerfully effective that you will notice the results overnight. We’re talking about giving you not only the ability to overcome what is currently challenging you but to empower you with the ability to succeed in any aspect of your life.

YOU’LL HAVE THE POWER


And do not forget that the net result of your efforts is not just the impregnation of information but the ability to tap into an awesome power that can align the forces of physical reality at your command. This is God’s true blessing and the reason why you don’t have to continually beg him for the things you need in life. He has given you the power to get them and more. Imagine if you will having the power to reshape the world to give you the things you need. This is why our approach is so different.

In this extraordinary program you will be taken into trance induction where we will remove any block, emotional fears, addictions, and provide you with powerful suggestions to get better grades or excel in your chosen career or sport.  Lastly you will learn how to perform miracles through synchronicity by attracting all the things you want in life. So powerful is this technique that you will never look at reality in the same way again. Stop trying to achieve your ambitions by physical means alone: let us show you a new world and reality where magic happens. Sign up for a free session to experience your power within!

Qesankh Maa Kheperu is known throughout the country. Here is what his technique can do for you:

·  Overcome emotional trauma

·  Eliminate everyday stress

But that’s not all. Because your spirit is all power and connected to everyone and everything, Master Teacher Qesankh Maa Kheperu will work with you to tap into your power to accomplish the following:

Bi-Perspective is the longest-running social, discussion and support group for ALL bisexual/non-monosexual, queer-identified and questioning people meeting in the New York City area.

Monthly meetings are held on the 1st Saturday of every month from 2:30 PM to 4:00 PM at the LGBT Community Center, followed by a convivial Coffee & Desert at a nearby local restaurant. The group provides a warm & friendly, welcoming, caring, SAFE, non-discriminatory environment for everyone who lives, works or plays in the New York City area.

Come visit and share your Feelings, Hopes and Dreams as well as your Fears, Concerns and Uncertainties with us. And of course, Joy and Laughter are always welcome at our meetings too! Bi-Perspective, a great way to meet others from the community and to make new friends in the New York area.

$5 (more if/less if) suggested donation to help defray room-rental cost

results.description:
Open Painting Meet-Up focuses on having a setting conducive to exploring your creative side through painting. We primarily meet in group organizer/artist Thomas Legaspi's Art Studio/School where artists can come and paint bathed in North Light from a wall of windows.  Painters can paint from still-life set-up, photographs, their digital tablets, or imagination. There are easels, slop sinks, painting racks, clean-up supplies, solvents, and soaps, provided. A $25 fee is charged for the 2.5 hour meet-up. Artists should supply their own materials such as paints, brushes, and canvases, etc. Instruction and supplies are available for additional costs. $35 with instruction and your own materials, $45 with materials to be supplied as well as instruction.

Planned Meet-ups include outdoor plein air paintings, trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Bronx Botanical Gardens, painting from the live model in outdoor settings.

Saturdays from 2:30 PM to 5:00PM. Sunday session from 2:30PM to 5:00PM. And on Wednesdays from 6:30 to 9:00. Most Meet-up events have light refreshments and background music.


Please view the organizer's website for images of his work and more information- www.thomaslegaspi-art.com.

Thanks and Happy Painting!

results.description:
THIS SATURDAY --- 3PM - 5PM

A slam dunk script is one that generates a bidding war, is universally accepted as a winner, and ends up selling for high six figures or more.

Is there a strategy and a roadmap to achieving a slam dunk?

Steve Kaire's unique worrkshop will reveal it.

The Seminar will Cover:

Why Starting Out With a High Concept Idea is Mandatory

High Concept maximizes your chances of selling your script with a unique, original premise.

Choosing One of the Top 4 Genres

Knowing which genres are the easiest to sell makes your script more in demand.

Picking the Right Title

Your title is what people remember and it should convey 2 important factors. I'll tell you what they are.

Perfecting Your Script with Rewrites & Script Analysts

Writers rush to put their scripts out there before they are ready for marketing. Feedback from the pros is absolutely necessary.

Having a Tight Pitch

The best material poorly presented is wasted. I'll show you what elements go into a successful pitch performance.

Having a List of Top Agents at the Ready

I'll let you in on the simplest method of getting representation for your screenplays.

Being Professional Every Step of the Way

Desperation and a negative attitude is not the approach you want to take. I'll tell you how to handle yourself.


Who Should Attend?

• First time writers who want to sell scripts to Hollywood

• Screenwriters who want a better understanding of what goes into a memorable genre movie.

• Seasoned writers wondering why their romantic comedies, sci fi movies, coming of age comedies or action scripts are falling flat with producers

• Writers who are eager to get into genre movies but have no clue beyond a boy meeting a girl or buildings blowing up what a genre movie is, or how to make it gripping and unforgettable.

BIO:

STEVE KAIRE is a Screenwriter/Pitchman who’s sold 8 projects to the major studios without representation. The last project he sold, he’s Co-Producing for Walden Media.
A screenwriter for over 30 years, he holds a Masters in Dramatic Writing and has taught writing classes at the American Film Institute. Steve was featured on the Tonight Show’s, “Pitching to America” and was voted a Star Speaker at Screenwriters Expo three years in a row.

His top rated CD, “High Concept - How to Create, Pitch & Sell to Hollywood” is a best seller.

His website is: HighConceptScreenwriting.com

WHERE AND WHEN:

August 1st
SATURDAY 3PM - 5PM


Studios353 - 353 west 48th street
(bet. 8th Ave and 9th Ave.)
2nd floor - follow the signs.

results.description:
I keep an eye on the weather and the field.  In the case of inclement weather - I try to make a determination as early as possible - preferably 24+ hours in advance, or by noon the day of if it's still questionable.  If we are not meeting, I will actually cancel the event page and send out an email.  If you are not signed up to receive emails, check the site, or text me[masked]


Basic Ground Rules for Participation


• no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc.   If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF.  If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...).  If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.



What is Ultimate Frisbee?  In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee.  You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Montclair)

results.description:
This is a walking tour in Central Harlem. Join us and explore the word-class visual vocabulary in the largest neighborhood of Manhattan. We will explore it's storied past, interesting present and visualize the promising future of this dynamic community.

Itinerary:

• The Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture 
• Harlem Hospital Mural 
• Abyssinian Baptist Church 
• Strivers Row (architectural gem of the community) 
• Harlem's Walk of Fame 
• The Apollo Theater 
• And Much More 

We will explore these and more sights using the visual links immediate to the location.

Reservations:
Please RSVP. If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide (Juan J.) in front of the Schomburg Center for Research in Black Culture by 1:50pm. Map here. Walk concludes at the Apollo Theater; map here.

Cost:
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!
results.how_to_find_us: Participants meet with the guide in front by the entrance of the meeting location.
results.name: The Art & Culture of Central Harlem

results.description:
Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Dear Friends,

Our July 11th concert was postponed due to an unexpected closure at the DiMenna Center. Enclosed are details for this concert, rescheduled for Saturday, August 1st, 2015:

OPENING COMMENTS

1. Nocturne Op. 48, No. 1 in C Minor (F. Chopin):  Barbara Napholtz (Piano)

2.  Première Rhapsodie (C. Debussy): Kevin Blum (Clarinet), Paavana Kumar (Piano)

3.  Consolation D flat major No.3 (F. Liszt): Dick LaVine (Tango Dancer), Serena LaVine (Tango Dancer), recording V. Horowitz.

INTERMISSION 


4.  Capricho Arabe (F. Tarrega), Serenata Espanola (J. Malats) Anthony Purdy (Guitar) 

5.  Richard Cory, Luke Havergal, Miniver Cheevy (J. Duke): David Mitchell (Baritone), Toshiko Jones (Piano)

6.  Rhapsody in Blue (G. Gershwin): Gail Artiaga (Piano)

ACMA Concert Location Details:

DiMenna Center for Classical Music, Norman S. Benzaquen Hall (2nd Floor)
450 West 37th Street (between 9th and 10th Avenues), New York, NY 10018

If you have any questions regarding this event, please email me at [masked].

We will start as close to 4:00 p.m. as possible. Your punctuality is greatly appreciated.

Transportation

The DiMenna Center is conveniently located on 37th Street between 9th and 10th Avenues, within minutes of Port Authority, Penn Station, and Grand Central Station transportation hubs.

Subway:

A, C, E trains to 34th Street and 8th Avenue

1, 2, 3, LIRR trains to 34th Street and 7th Avenue

Bus:

N, R, Q, B, D, F, M trains to 34th Street and 6th Avenue

N, Q, R, S, 1, 2, 3, 7 trains to Times Square 42nd Street and 7th Avenue

M11 bus to 38th Street and 9th Avenue

M42 bus to 42nd Street and 10th Avenue

Contributions

We suggest a $5.00 contribution per person, to be directly applied towards payment of the hall rental. Contributions are voluntary, and any amount is greatly appreciated.

For Performers (Please read the Performance Tips page on the ACMA website):

What is the high point of your piece? Every musical and dramatic work takes its audience on a journey, generally consisting of the following elements:

1-) Introduction and elaboration: The central melodic theme is introduced and often repeated, in identical fashion or with variation. The mood of the piece is presented and established via use of dynamics, tempo and melodic arc.

The performer must draw in the audience at this point, either with a compelling narrative subtext, or strong emotional message. Also, the performer must build gradual tension (when applicable), leading the audience to the musical climax.

2-) Climax: The highest emotional point of the work, usually occurring 2/3 to ¾ into the piece. Requires maximum expression and melodic emphasis to evoke a desired reaction or response from the audience. Also considered a reward point, or tension release for the audience.

The performer should fully understand the climactic point of the piece, and clearly highlight this point via the use of tone, dynamic expression and musical touch. The importance of the climax for audience understanding and satisfaction cannot be underestimated.

3-) Resolution: The conclusion of the piece, during which all unresolved musical elements are resolved in a decisive manner.

The performer must prepare the audience for the eventual end of the musical journey, a return to reality. Musical cues which aid this transition include:

·  gradual decrescendo and diminuendo

·  a clear a decisive  end point , so as to not leave the audience with an uneasy feeling of something unresolved

Entertain your audience: Great entertainers (actors, singers, etc.) put their unique personality into every performance. If you want to make a memorable impression upon your audience, introduce a new, unique perspective on your piece. Once you truly own your piece, it should carry the inimitable stamp of your personality, but also sound as if it is being performed for the first time.

Select pieces that are personally meaningful to you, and allow for your maximum expression as both performer and entertainer.

Performances do not have to be memorized, or note-perfect. However, as a courtesy to your audience, please present a work that you have studied attentively, and can play to its completion.

If you make a mistake during your performance, please continue to play without stopping. Apologizing, repeating a previously played section, or stopping will only call more attention to your mistake.
results.how_to_find_us: website: www.nycclassical.com, email: acma@nycclassical.com
results.name: Rescheduled: ACMA July 2015 Concert

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at the set of benches with the number 8 above them in the Center For Education room, which is straight ahead when you get past coat check. At 4:15pm we will split up. Then meet up at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30.
results.name: Saturday Afternoon Galleries and Balcony Bar

results.description:
The focus will be on presenting artworks by different artists and my own. The works are sculptures that are sometimes soft, playful, humorous, or with relational aesthetics. 

 The art component will focus on Art history beginning with Post-War art until today. We will discuss some of the major artists that have lead to the current aesthetics and concepts of today. 

 After viewing and discussing different artist from the past and present, the group will convene to create and participate in a work FOOD II, (A 1971 restaurant project in Soho by artists Carol Goodden, and Tina Girouard). This conceptual restaurant occurs in a domestic space and includes a fusion of the Argentine "Asado" with Mediterranean the American BBQ. 

 The event is intended to bring people together under a common theme for those who appreciate fine art, food, and exterior space. We will eat in a small sculpture garden at the place.

Date: Aug 1 - 4pm - 3hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Tickets: https://goo.gl/MTODvg

*Exact number of participants may vary, check the ticket link for the most up to date information

Economy Candy has been in the Lower East Side for over 50 years. It has a ton of sweets you won't find anywhere else, including old-fashioned candy, gourmet chocolates, dried fruit, nuts, special edition Pez, and more common stuff like Wonka candy.

http://www.economycandy.com


Afterwards, we can walk around the neighborhood and just chill out; I know a couple places that would be cool to explore. If we stay out late enough, maybe we can grab dinner.

Note (Posted Thursday July 30th 8:39AM): 

We have another meetup scheduled for afterwards: http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Recent-College-Grads-21-28/events/224282110/

After Economy Candy, we can still walk around for a bit and end up by the 2nd Avenue F subway station, which we can take straight to Bryant Park.

Updated (Posted Saturday August 1st 2:21PM):

We will leave the candy store at 4:45 in order to get to Bryant Park by 5:15.

venue.name: BAM (Brooklyn Academy of Music)

results.description:
Let's see an early show so that we can go for BBQ at The Smoke Joint afterwards, without fighting huge crowds at either establishment.   I highly suggest you purchase your movie ticket in advance since BAM is very popular and shows sell out quickly.

Ticket purchase and trailer:  http://www.bam.org/film/2015/irrational-man

Address/directions to The Smoke Joint:  https://www.google.com/maps/place/The+Smoke+Joint/@40.6869207,-73.9753372,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m2!3m1!1s0x89c25bb1a3c61783:0x1899ea87df25713a

Rolling Stone claims this film is "a suspenseful mind-teaser. The comedy is black and stinging hot."  

In this darkly funny crime film, Woody Allen returns to the existential themes of his 1989 masterpiece Crimes and Misdemeanors in the story of a philosophy professor (Phoenix) seeking purpose in life after hitting rock bottom. Soon after arriving to teach at a small-town college, he becomes involved in emotionally fraught relationships with a lonely professor (Posey) and his best student (Stone), ultimately making a decision that will change the course of his life forever. Boasting beautiful CinemaScope photography by Darius Khondji, Irrational Man finds Allen at his most intellectually rigorous and formally ambitious.
results.how_to_find_us: I'll be holding a Meetup sign near the ticket purchase counters
results.name: See Woody Allen's "Irrational Man" at BAM

results.description:
The focus will be on presenting artworks by different artists and my own. The works are sculptures that are sometimes soft, playful, humorous, or with relational aesthetics. 

 The art component will focus on Art history beginning with Post-War art until today. We will discuss some of the major artists that have lead to the current aesthetics and concepts of today. 

 After viewing and discussing different artist from the past and present, the group will convene to create and participate in a work FOOD II, (A 1971 restaurant project in Soho by artists Carol Goodden, and Tina Girouard). This conceptual restaurant occurs in a domestic space and includes a fusion of the Argentine "Asado" with Mediterranean the American BBQ. 

 The event is intended to bring people together under a common theme for those who appreciate fine art, food, and exterior space. We will eat in a small sculpture garden at the place.

Date: Aug 1 - 4pm - 3hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Tickets: https://goo.gl/MTODvg

*Exact number of participants may vary, check the ticket link for the most up to date information

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

From 5:00pm-7:30pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

<a href="http://citeseerx.ist.psu.edu/viewdoc/download?doi=10.1.1.335.9655&rep=rep1&type=pdf">Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.name: A Conversation About Happiness, Citicorp at 53rd and Lex.

The Brooklyn Ark is incredibly excited to be linking up with Dining With Grace for an evening of providing amazing gourmet food, live music, and acts of kindness to homeless families who are living in the homeless shelters around the city.

Would you consider helping in one of these three ways?

1) Volunteer to help us set-up, prep food, serve and tear down August 1st from 10am to 9pm.  SIGN-UP TO VOLUNTEER HERE.

2) Donate to help us cover the costs of food, decor, transportation, gift bags, children's events and more! DONATE HERE.

3) Network to help us spread the word about this awesome cause.  We need to either raise money or network with (a) a charter bus company to transport the families to the banquet site, (b) stores to help fill back-to-school backpacks for the children and toiletries for the adults, and (c) supermarkets to donate food for the recipes.  Please let us know if you are interested in helping donate and what you would like your gift to be.  

Thank you for helping us make this a reality!
