UPDATE: Last week of July Series - 8 count footwork!!  We will work on Swing Out, the signature move of Lindy Hop!!  We will not be teaching swing out for another 3 months so come learn it this week even if you missed the 1st 3 weeks!!  Here is the video from last week!!!  Go Team Week 3!!

*******************************************************


We are so excited to announce that we will continue to hold beginner series in ASTORIA!!!  

Please join us for the basics of swing dancing and lindy hop! No partner or experience necessary, just bring your comfortable shoes and happy feet!! We will meet every Saturday from 5pm to 6pm in July (7/11, 18, 25 and August 1st) so that you will be comfortable with the basic steps of swing dancing.  We will rotate partners frequently during the lesson so you will instantly make lots of new friends!!  At the end of each class, you will have a chance to mingle and dance with each other and try out all the new moves you just learned to authentic jazz music from 30s and 40s!!

Although drop ins are welcome, we highly recommend to attend all 4 classes to learn various steps of swing dancing so that you will be comfortable on the social dance floor.  Besides, there is a big discount by signing up for the whole month so please take advantage of it!!  $52 for 4 classes or $15 for single class.


Space is limited and only advance purchase will guarantee your spot!  Please register in advance at QED website and get the discount!!  We will put the link to QED website as soon as it is ready. 

This month, we will be focusing on 8 count basics!  By the end of this course, we are hoping that students will get familiar with Swing Out, the signature move of Lindy Hop!! 


Classes are taught by Michael Duke and Akemi Kinukawa, very experienced and friendly instructors of Swing Dance Astoria (www.Facebook.com/swingdanceastoria). 
Looking forward to dancing with you!

Here is a video from the last workshop at QED:

https://www.facebook.com/video.php?v=537214196418671&set=vb.395724470567645&type=2&theater

If you are interested in finding out what types of materials we cover in the beginner class, please go to

Facebook group Swing Dance Astoria and check out the recap video!!  (and like us : ) https://www.facebook.com/swingdanceastoria

results.description:
The first Saturday of every month we meet at 5 pm, instead of the normal weekly Saturday meeting time of 2 pm.

After our meditation program, which ends by 7 pm, we enjoy a healthy potluck dinner.  Please join us!  It's really a great way for us to get to know each other better. 

Log onto www.perfectpotluck.com to let us know what you'd like to bring. Type in Administrator: Fitzpatrick, password: Ananda. You can see what others are bringing to help you decide! Call Linda Fitzpatrick at[masked] if you have any questions or need help entering your food selection on the perfectpotluck.com site.

The potluck goes on until about 9 pm; although you can leave anytime you like.  It's all very informal and friendly.

We meet at the Wilson House of the First Baptist Church, 456 North Street (corner of Bryant Ave.) in White Plains. Email Merrill Harmin, [masked] if you have questions.

Our typical agenda:

- We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives.
- Then we meditate together chanting mantra followed by the beautiful sounds of a gong.
- And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can.

The group has been meeting for some time before Meetup began. The Meetup page is not a reflection of the group's attendance as it shows only the Meetup members that are planning to attend a particular meeting. The special potluck meeting we hold the first Saturday of each month has an average attendance of about two dozen members.
results.name: American Meditation Society  - Monthly Meditation and Potluck Dinner

results.description:
• EVENT TYPE: Dining


*Please note: We will meet outside the restaurant at 5:30pm.  If you need to reach me, my name is Krystle, my email is [masked]. 

I just found out this place is CASH ONLY. We will be ordering all the famous dishes so we will do FAMILY STYLE.*

DESCRIPTION:

What? Korean-Uzbek food? Yes, it does exist. How? Well, it turns out like most dictators, Stalin was an a**hole and forcibly relocated around 174,000 Korean people from Russia to Uzbekistan and Kazakhstan in the 1930s. One result of this devastating displacement was the creation of Korean-Uzbek cuisine, and since this is New York, you don’t have to go to Uzbekistan to try it. Elza Fancy Food, a.k.a. Cafe “At Your Mother-in-Law,” is a Korean-Uzbek restaurant in Brighton Beach, right off the boardwalk.


Directions: (From Port Authority) 

Take D train downtown to 18th AVE./20th Ave/ Bay Pkwy

MENU:

http://www.menupages.com/restaurants/cafe-at-your-mother-in-law/menu

FOOD GALLERY:

• Kuksu: At first glance this looks like a routine Chinese lo mein soup, only skewed toward Korean tastes, but a second reveals that the roster of ingredients makes this more like a floating form of bibimbap. And who ever heard of lo mein with lamb? No matter how you interpret it, the soup is scrumptious and a perfect light meal.

• Chicken Tabaka: This Georgian invention (aka "roadkill chicken") is smashed under a brick as it's roasted, and was transmitted to nearly every corner of the former Soviet Union. In the Korean-Uzbek style, though, it's presented without broth and smeared with a sweet chili sauce.

• Mash-Hurdy: Basically, it's a minute steak smeared with mayo and wrapped up inside a thin omelet. Did it originate as a Uzbek form of fast food? Origin aside, this wrap is one you won't be embarrassed to be seen eating.

• Samsa: this hand-held pastry can be had stuffed with pumpkin or stuffed with lamb. Three would make a full meal.

• Tripe Hye: This is one of a series of cold salads on the menu laced with chili sauce. In this case, in addition to carrots, the main ingredient is honeycomb cow tripe, and you've never tasted tenderer.

RESTAURANT GALLERY:

• Inside the Restaurant 1

• Inside the Restaurant 2

RESTAURANT REVIEW:

http://www.yelp.com/biz/elza-fancy-food-brooklyn-2

http://www.villagevoice.com/restaurants/7-best-things-to-eat-at-elza-fancy-foods-6589988

DISCLAIMER:

http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer

END

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.
results.how_to_find_us: The meeting is at 26 2nd Avenue, between 1st St. and 2nd St. You can take the F train and get off at the 2nd Ave. stop (and use the 2nd Ave. exit at that station).
results.name: Bhagavad-gita Class & Kirtan @ 5:30 p.m. on Saturdays at 26 2nd Avenue, NY, NY

group.name: Kirtan Yoga & Bhagavad Gita As It Is Discourses -- NYC

results.description:
"In The Drilling Company's production for Bryant Park Shakespeare, the play will be set in a modern city which is divided by wealth and class. Directed by David Marantz, it aims to send a clear message about the violence that can result from social division and corporate greed."

Note: It starts at 6:30, but I want us to be there early so we can find a place to sit. There will be seats, but we will probably be on the grass if there are too many of us.

Things to bring/keep in mind:
- blankets
- something to drink (no alcohol)
- food for yourself (you don't need to bring for all of us, but if you do, that would be nice)
- there are also a lot of food places across the street (Chipotle, Hale and Hearty, Cosi, Pret a Manger) and some food vendors in the park (gelato, Wafels & Dinges, Wichcraft)

- they might do a bag check

- beforehand, we will be coming from this meetup: http://www.meetup.com/NYC-Recent-College-Grads-21-28/events/224275259/

You can leave whenever you want; you don't have to stay till the end.
For more info:
http://www.bryantpark.org/plan-your-visit/shakespeare.html
http://shakespeareintheparkinglot.com

Updated (Posted Saturday August 1st 2:23PM):

We will arrive around 5:15 to ensure seats.
results.how_to_find_us: Inbox me your number if you plan on attending. Since there are  several entrances and places to sit, I don't know where we will be.
results.name: (Free) Romeo & Juliet in Bryant Park

results.description: Bring the script, a blanket to spread on the grass, your own beverage, and some munchies to share with all. We will run a few rounds of rehearsal. Important - please practice your parts (best is if you memorize - the actual natok will be like a real natok, not script reading). As a group, we will assess how the casting fits the roles - so it's important that your performance is as close as possible to the real thing. Please come prepared. Let's make this a success!
results.name: Natok in the Park; Shakespeare - hark, hark!

results.description:
Lil' Frankie's! Tempt your taste buds and take a bite of flavors of Italy!

Let’s go and sample the specialties of life; Italian Style. Specialty Dishes, Real Pizza and the fine Wines of Italy! 

NYC Leisure Travelers; I want to take you on a gourmet excursion to Italy. Yes! Let’s go and learn how to broaden our palates by tasting Italy’s homemade dishes! Frank will definitely show you how. This is the reality of Italy, come one, come all and join NYC Leisure Travelers as we enjoy the fine gourmet eateries of Italy right in our backyard in the fabulous Big Apple. You don’t want to miss this date!

https://youtu.be/4-PH2yQZd-0

Lil' Frankie's Pizza

Who: Frank Prisinzano

What: Another forgotten (or never discovered) gem full of back vintage wines at very low prices.

Where: 19 1st Avenue, Manhattan

All of Frank Prisinzano's restaurants (Frank, Supper, Lil' Frankie's) have wine lists that, however hodgepodge, are very deep collections of Italian wine with plenty of great finds, offered well below NYC standard. The list at Lil' Frankie's tops out at around 500 selections, with a nice selection of half bottles and a "by consumption" policy that allows diners to choose any bottle on the list and be charged only for the amount they drink, whether it be a glass or 3/4 of a bottle.

It’s not the fanciest of places, but it’s rooted in memories, and incredible food. It’ll be wonderful, warm, and inviting: the perfect ingredients for a celebration.

No-frills, cash-only eatery offering wood-fired pizza & other casual Italian dishes.

Address: 19 1st Avenue, New York, NY 10003

    Italian, East Village

Phone: (212)[masked]

HOURS

Monday-Thursday: 4:00pm - 2:00am 
Friday: 4:00pm - 4:00am 
Saturday: 11:00am - 4:00am 
Sunday: 11:00am - 2:00am

Reservations: Open table

Price: $30 and under.

results.name: Lil' Frankie's! Let’s go and sample the specialties of life. Pizza and Wine!

results.description:
This holiday is a time of celebrating not only the first crops of the harvest season but also, celebrating the things we have harvested in our lives throughout the year. As the strength of the God slowly starts to diminish, it is also a celebration of letting go of regrets and things we will not be able to tackle this year. There will be an open forum class about the holiday and Braided Wheel Wicca before the ritual at 6. At around 6:45 we will head to a spot for ritual then cast circle at around 7 pm please try to bring food to contribute for our feast of the harvest after or for the cakes and ale of the ritual. Please RSVP ASAP so we can start to get an idea of numbers and let me know in the questions what you will be bringing and if you would like to help lead ritual.

~*Brightest Blessings*~

Presiding Priest Ιάκωβος Ξενύχτης
results.name: Lammas - The first harvest.

results.description: If you can listen with your eyes and talk with your hands, then join us on Saturday evenings at Panera Bread in Little Neck, Queens. This group is open to experts (whether deaf, hard of hearing, or hearing) and novices alike. However, you don't have to be an expert to attend since many of our members are students.   We meet to socialize and to practice and improve our ASL skills. Feel free to bring ideas to the meetings such as activities we can do together, or to simply come and chat. Since we are meeting in a business establishment, we strongly encourage you to make a purchase.  You can enjoy a delicious meal or snack and relax too! Hope to see you there!

results.description:
Free Usui Reiki Level 1 Distant Attunement

</a>The Padmacahaya International Institute for Inner studies is providing free of charge the Usui Reiki Level 1 attunement (via long distance) and the Open Heart Meditation for the public (via written form on the website for printing.)  Anyone with a willing and open heart can do this. You can follow the link above or read about it in our discussion board  The attunement is offered every 1st of the month at 6:30pm your local time and the duration lasts 15 minutes.  Open Heart Meditation can be practiced daily - either once, twice or as much needed throughout the day.  It is suggested to continue with the daily practice of the Open Heart Meditation and Self-Healing once a day for at least 21 days to notice changes.

A professionally created Open Heart Meditation with music in the background can also be purchased online in Itunes  <a href="https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/open-heart-meditation/id677392454?i=677392941">https://itunes.apple.com/us/album/open-heart-meditation/id677392454?i=677392941 or CD Baby - http://www.cdbaby.com/cd/irmansyaheffendi2

Full day classes in the United States and in some parts of the World will be posted in the discussion board.

If anyone in the NYC area is interested in classes, please let us know.  There are two paths to choose from - Open Heart Workshops and Reiki TUMMO Workshops.  Both are so beautiful and lead you deeper into the heart to live a more joyful, peaceful life.

With Gratitude,
the NYC/Lower CT group.

results.description:
Us And Floyd is a Long Island, New York based Pink Floyd tribute band. Us and Floyd strives to perform accurate recreations of the timeless music of Pink Floyd. These professional musicians have grown up as avid Floyd fans and incorporate their knowledge of the band and it's history into every live show. Their collective appreciation for Floyd is evidenced by the passion and precision of their performances.

The band covers songs from the vast catalog of albums including: Atom Heart Mother, Meddle, Dark Side of The Moon, Wish You Were Here, Animals, The Wall and The Final Cut.

There are limited opportunities to catch this music performed live. So join Us And Floyd as we honor the works of the greatest progressive rock act of all time; Pink Floyd!

$62- Mediterranean meal, gl of wine, coffee/tea t&t. From the pita and hummus made hourly to the sauces, baklava and falafel, everything except the wine and veggies are handmade in house from scratch, at this 6 month old newcomer to Midtown East. With a taste of the entire Mediterranean, our menu consists of meze including tabule, hummus, briwat, falafel and Mediterranean salad, and then choices from chicken, lamb, shashuka and veggies. If you enjoyed our last Rooftop Party at the Dream hotel, and Winter Thaw rooftop at the One, then prepare yourself to be melted with a hot summer night of partying when the One hotel opens up its rooftop bar and seating. Featuring DJ Mendola spinning live music. Come after to work to relax, have a drink, and dance the night away at THE ONE Rooftop Hotel. Accessible via the 7 Train.

• Bring valid ID

• ((Dress to Impress))

• Discount on Hotel rooms. Message Jaewan if interested ahead of time. 

• Free entrance after RSVP. Just say you are with Jaewan's party.

• Drink and food specials before 9pm:

-Well drink cocktails $7

- Appetizers $5.99

- Beers $4

After 9pm well cocktails are $10, $5 beers, Appetizers $10.

• Bottles service packages will be offered at 2 bottle for $300 w/ a fruit plate and bucket of 5 beers. 

Menu Items:

Korean spicy wings, Korean soy garlic wings, buffalo style wings, smoke salmon bruschetta, cheese plate, mixed fruit plate, burger with fries, margarita flat pizza, beer batter jumbo onion ring, fried calamari w/ sweet chili glaze. 

Please RSVP and update RSVP as the place has limited space and I need to get an idea of the size of our party ahead of time.

RSVP to be added to Jaewan's guestlist. Check in at front table. I will be handing out name tags and wristbands which will give you access to VIP area and reduced drink and meal prices. Private message well in advance for questions.

results.description: They say there's nothing like a good steak and I have to agree to that. Empire Steakhouse has done very successful in the last few years serving the best of steaks in a beautiful dining room setting. This is the second restaurant Empire has open up due to the success they had ( the one we are using is the 54th St location) If you have never gone to a steahouse with our group I just want to aware you of the following. We used only upscale venues with eye struck surroundings. Many of the steakhouse we used our listed in the top 10 in the city by many lists. In the past we have used Benjamin, Staler, Capital, Ben & Jack's, Delmonico, Strip House and just recently Angus on Valentine's Day. An average steak here is about $48. For those who want a non steak meal , the average entree is $35. All steak venues are well prepared that there are many non meat eaters and served some of the best seafood dishes in the city. Each couple is responsible for the cost of their own meal. This will be the last steakhouse we are using for the year so join the bandwagon as we open up August with a special dinner experience.
results.name: Empire Steakhouse

results.description:
Lughnassadh is the ancient fire festival, and one of the Great Sabbats, when Pagans mark the shortening days and celebrate the first harvest. His death reflected the dying of Lugh, the Sun God. The waning light heralded the coming of darkness and winter. The Goddess become the Reaper, and attends the God in His passing. Sober but not tragic, as the God says in

The Lord of the Dance

I sleep in the kernel and I dance in the rain;

I dance in the wind and in the waving grain;

And when you cut me down I care nothing for the pain:

In the spring I’m the Lord of the Dance once again!

A time for sharing so bring foods of all kinds to share, eg: corn, berries, apple cider, wine in a plastic bottle, corn bread, grained bread, grape juice, veggies, fruits etc.

Attuning to the season by sacrificing whatever is inappropriate in our lives, like fear or unrealistic expectations; by completing all projects and goals. Accept the responsibility as well as the rewards of our labors.

You can also bring the tools of your trade whatever it is to be blessed and thank the God/Goddess for their many blessings and your continued success. This symbolizes your ability to produce results. It will also ensure the satisfactory completion of your work, or bountiful harvest, at the Autumn Equinox to follow. Many successes to you all.

BRING HAND INSTRUMENTS -- drums, flutes, tambourines, claves, maracas, etc. AS IT IS A GREAT TIME FOR DANCING AND MERRIMENT.

Attire: suggested attire color white, black, yellow, orange (not required for attendance).

A fee of $15.00 in person $16.00 via online payments is required. (please bring receipt of online payment).

Payments online www./wftacademyofpaganstudies.org or
at meetup: http:// www.wiccanfamilytemple.org .

THANK YOU, BLESSED BE.
results.name: Lughnassad/Lammas

There's always a friendly staff member on sale to help teach rules and make sure everyone gets into a game!

Admission is by any Modern Myths Event Pass (Day Passes are $5 that you get back in store credit, Monthly and Yearly options are also available). Ages 13+, younger if parent is present at the event.

results.description:
STARTING: on the back steps of Brooklyn Borough President building as seen in the image below and via this link, join multiple meetup groups as we walk down Atlantic Avenue to Brooklyn Bridge Park and catch the sunset then head over the Brooklyn Bridge at night for REALLY spectacular views of the city. 

WHEN: The meeting time is 7 pm and we'll hang out and get to know each other for 30 minutes before we head out on this awesome walk. 

WHO WILL BE ON THIS WALK? Date Walks contain an unlimited amount of people in a specified age range. Sometimes there's 20 people and sometimes there's 50 people and sometimes there's 200 people like the one we did last year on the High Line. I like big groups because the more people there are, the more people there are to meet. 

WHAT TO EXPECT: Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend/non-awkward and the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

SUBWAY: As you can see from this link, there are tons of subway station stops encompassing this meetup location. The N/R Court Street stop, the 2/3 Borough Hall stop, the 4/5 Borough Hall stop, and the A/C/F Jay Street stop. The LIRR is fairly close too at .9 miles away. 

DISTANCE & ROUTE: From point A to B is a little over 3 miles.

PACE: The pace of this walk will be super casual.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call. 

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer

A time for sharing so bring foods of all kinds to share, eg: corn, berries, apple cider, wine in a plastic bottle, corn bread, grained bread, grape juice, veggies, fruits etc.

Attuning to the season by sacrificing whatever is inappropriate in our lives, like fear or unrealistic expectations; by completing all projects and goals. Accept the responsibility as well as the rewards of our labors.

You can also bring the tools of your trade whatever it is to be blessed and thank the God/Goddess for their many blessings and your continued success. This symbolizes your ability to produce results. It will also ensure the satisfactory completion of your work, or bountiful harvest, at the Autumn Equinox to follow. Many successes to you all.

BRING HAND INSTRUMENTS -- drums, flutes, tambourines, claves, maracas, etc. AS IT IS A GREAT TIME FOR DANCING AND MERRIMENT.

Attire: suggested attire color white, black, yellow, orange (not required for attendance).

A fee of $15.00 in person $16.00 via online payments is required. (please bring receipt of online payment).

Payments online www./wftacademyofpaganstudies.org or
at meetup: http:// www.wiccanfamilytemple.org .

THANK YOU, BLESSED BE.

results.description:
Please read carefully: This event is being sponsored by Dave Cervini's newyorksocialnetwork.com and several of their partner Meet Up groups.  The number of people registered on this Meet Up represent only a portion of those actually attending. If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending please contact the event host at [masked]

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN staff members will be there to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

This will also be a great opportunity to see what we have in store for 2015.

The Campbell Terrace is a cool outdoor covered patio bar located on the west side of Grand Central.  It has a nice loungy atmosphere with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any public transportation to Grand Central

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 11:30-Midnight

 Admission is $5.00 prepay $10 at door. 


There does not seem to be a lot of people registered on this Meet Up, are there more people going? Yes as explained, this event is being promoted by several Meet Up groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com.  There will be tons of people attending.  If you have any questions you can contact the event organizer directly at [masked] or call[masked]

results.description:
August 1, 2015 Caribbean Heritage
MUSIC

https://www.brooklynmuseum.org/visit/first_saturdays 

5:00 p.m.
BombaYo performs traditional Afro Puerto Rican bomba drumming, which combines West African, Taino, and Spanish percussion. Presented in partnership with CaribBEING.

FILM

5:00–9:00 p.m.
Experimental media program Black Radical Imagination presents short films made by women of color who have connections to the Caribbean.

PERFORMANCE

6:00 p.m.
The Braata Folk Singers present Caribbean folk music representing the diverse cultures of the West Indies.

POP-UP CARNIVAL

6:00–9:00 p.m.
Poet Arielle John performs and hosts a presentation of carnival costumes and musical traditions from various Caribbean islands. Curated by CaribBEING.

HANDS-ON ART

6:30–8:30 p.m.
Explore carving, printing, and layering techniques in printmaking to create an island landscape.

FILM

7:00 p.m.
Papa Machete (Jonathan David Kane, 2014, 10 min.) tells the story of one of the few remaining masters of machete fencing, a martial art which emerged from the Haitian Revolution. A Q&A with the director follows. Presented in partnership with CaribBEING.

BOOK CLUB


8:30 p.m.
Naomi Jackson, raised in Brooklyn by West Indian parents, discusses her new novel, The Star Side of Bird Hill (Penguin Press, June 2015), a story about community, betrayal, and love centered on a matriarchal family in Barbados.


MUSIC

9:00 p.m.
Klash City Sound System and Supa Frendz perform a mash up of reggae, punk, and hip-hop, expanding notions of Caribbean music.
results.name: First Saturday at the Brooklyn Museum

results.name: Lets meet Dennis Dunaway !!!

results.description:
Tickets Here! https://goo.gl/BsyYks

Have you ever wanted to create a painting on Canvas but lack the know how or tools to do so? This class is for you, Picasso! Each new artist is walked through, step by step a pre-selected painting. Each artist receives a 16x20 canvas and all supplies and materials. Everyone is encouraged to add their own spark to their painting!

I patiently help all of our artists as we break down each selected painting to make it easier for everyone to achieve results. All beginning artists are able to leave the day of the class with their very own paintings. Hang it on your wall, give it to a friend or make it a special gift - the choice is yours! Small snacks, beverages, wine and/or beer are welcomed during our classes. Lets have fun and get creative!
results.name: Create Your First Canvas Painting!

results.description:
Looking to get out and meet new people in a friendly, private and casual environment? Join us for this multi-group social for all new and existing Meetup members.  

Forget about overcrowded bars, long lines to get in and people with attitudes. This will be one of the most friendliest and social Meetups you'll experience! 

We will have our staff there to welcome all members and help introduce you to each other.  It's fun and laid back event that creates the perfect opportunity to make new friends.  

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (TICKETS WILL NOT BE SOLD AT DOOR) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Aug-01-2015_at_0800PM

The Campbell Terrace is a cool outdoor covered patio bar located on the west side of Grand Central. It has a nice loungey atmosphere with lots of room to sit or wander around while meeting others. 

What to expect:

• Complimentary Hot & Cold Appetizers (8-9pm) 

• Drink Specials (8-9pm)

• Music At Just The Right Volume For Mingling 

• Socialize, Network & Connect With Other Members

PREPAY ONLY ($10 - Price goes to $15 as event gets closer) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Aug-01-2015_at_0800PM

FAQ: 

Can I come alone? Yes, 80% attending come on their own.

Why does your RSVP say +75? This is a multi-Meetup event and we expect over 75 members to attend. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? No, all are welcome 21+.

What do I wear? Neat casual. 

How do I get there? Take any east side line (4,5,6) trains to 42nd Grand Central. 

How do I attend? RSVP w/ group and purchase ticket - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Aug-01-2015_at_0800PM

<a href="https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/37/dates/Aug-01-2015_at_0800PM"></a>

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

results.description:
Single? New in town? Just looking to get out and meet new people?

Join us for our multi-group member happy hour! ATWYS along with New York Social Network organizes a monthly Saturday night get together for all of our new and existing members.

If you are new to our Meteup group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. Event Host, New York Social Network  founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The Campbell Terrace is a cool outdoor lounge covered and outside the east side of the Grand Central Terminal. 

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similiar groups.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 in advance only - $10 at door if available

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect. 

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.
results.name: Private Member Social Happy Hour @ Outside Patio Bar at Grand Central

results.description:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 in advance only - $10 at door if available

Prepay here: http://atwys2013member.eventbrite.com/

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~


The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN staff members will be there to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

This will also be a great opportunity to see what we have in store for 2015.

The Campbell Terrace is a cool outdoor covered patio bar located on the west side of Grand Central.  It has a nice loungy atmosphere with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any public transportation to Grand Central

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 11:30-Midnight

General Admission is $5.00 prepay $10 at door.  NYSN V.I.P. Members get FREE admission.  If you can not pay online you may bring exact change to the door.
results.name: Private Member Multi Group Social

We start meeting as early as 8pm and party til late. This will be our first time hosting at this venue, so should be a really exciting evening. Ruby Lounge is connected to a Holiday Inn Hotel and has a separate entrance. Just look for the Ruby Sign to know where to enter.

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Please arrive on time. All games begin promptly at 8:15pm. This should give any late comers 15 minutes to arrive in case you get stuck and time to warm up.

(4) Games will be 30-40 minute halves. We will switch sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $3.00 for the night. Permit cost me $1200 for the season, I'm not out to make money.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - Large Goals

results.description:
Secrets of Karma Revealed


Learn the Truth About Karma, Fate, Destiny and Free Will in Your Life

KARMA

As soon as you hear the word “Karma” so many questions pop up…

Whether you believe in it or not, Karma is a very REAL and powerful force in our lives.

Thinking that Karma is just simply “good” or “bad” and you reap what you sow is a very incomplete understanding.

So what does it really mean?

What is your Karma?

How is your Karma related to the purpose of your life?

Can your Karma even be changed?

Where is the truth between fate, destiny, and free will?

Unfortunately there’s a lot of misinformation out there, because it’s such a deep and mystical subject.

For the first time, you have the opportunity to learn answers to these questions and more, directly from a living Enlightened Master, Paramahamsa Nithyananda (“Swamiji”), who got Enlightened at the age of 12.

Swamiji will be revealing many deep life secrets about karma as part of his mission to awaken the world to higher consciousness. This is a very profound and life changing event that will certainly shift your reality to a higher space.

results.description:
Wu style Tai Chi and The Alexander Technique 

 In this class series, participants will learn the beginning of the Wu-Style Tai Chi form, a 108 sequence of movements. In addition, proper alignment within the form will be learned using the Alexander Technique. Tai Chi is an excellent way to practice Alexander Technique principles and to learn how to move with ease, relieve tension and to move more gracefully.  

Wu Style Tai Chi: is a Chinese martial arts system that uses slow, meditative, deliberate movements to learn a fighting system and healthy body posture. In particular, the Wu System uses a shorter stance to create more power and thrust from the practitioner’s base. Benefits include, pain relief, grace, joint health and stress-relief.

Date: Aug 1 - 10:30am - 1hr

*Use promo code SUMMERFLING for 25% off*

Tickets: https://goo.gl/MTODvg

*Exact number of participants may vary, check ticket link for the most up to date information

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.
results.name: Sunday at McLaughlin park 8:00 AM

results.description:
NEW YORK CENTRAL PARK TRIATHLON
Sunday, August 2, 2015
Swim (pool) - 0.25 mi. Bike - 12 mi. Run - 3 mi.

COMPETITOR INFO

ABSOLUTELY NO PARTS OF ENTRY WILL BE REFUNDED, TRANSFERRED OR CREDITED

The following rules and regulations have been designed for your personal safety and enjoyment. Failure to comply with these rules will result in penalties and/or disqualification.
Instructions at the pre-race briefing supersede any or all of the following rules.. IMPORTANT: NO NUMBERS WILL BE ISSUED WITHOUT PHOTO ID!
. Note: You will receive an email approximately one week before the event with a link to your bib number. You must know your bib number before getting in line for race packet pick up. There will be an alphabetical list of entrants posted near registration where you may also look uo your bib number.

Entry Fee:
Early Entry: $120 before 1/1/15
Regular Entry: $140 1/2/15 - 3/2/15
Late Entry: $150 after 3/3/15 - Race management has authority to change race course and format, check-in and start times.
- No entrants under 18 years of age.
- It is prohibited to sell your number or for someone to compete in your place.

Pre-Race Day - Saturday
5:00 - 6:30 pm - Check-in/packet pick up (optional) at Lasker Pool
Race Day - Sunday
6:00 - 7:10 am. - Check-in/packet pick up. Pick up timing chip.
7:15 am. - Mandatory pre-race briefing. No race packets saved after 7:10 am.
7:30 am - Start of Triathlon (rain or shine)
10:30 am - Course closes, awards, refreshments

AWARDS: 1st, 2nd, 3rd overall male and female in 5-year groups; 18 - 70+ (men), 18 - 60+ (women).

FIELD: Limited to first 300 applicants. Sign up early! This race fills up each year!

VOLUNTEERS NEEDED!: Is there someone you know who could help while you're competing? Call Race Director, Nancy Klitsner, at Parks & Recreation -[masked] ext. 306 from 9:00-4:00 and leave a message with their name and confirm that they will be at the race. Volunteers will receive a souvenir T-shirt and sincere thanks from all competitors.

SWIM: Six Lanes will be set up for the swim in Lasker Pool. Swimmers will line up by Bib Number and will enter the pool through the starting chute which will be located on the side opposite the bike racks. Swimmers will then enter the water individually as they are called forward one-at-a-time. Swimmers will be called approximately one every five seconds. Do not enter the water until you are instructed to do so bythe Race Official.

This type of swim is referred to as a "serpentine" swim with a "time trial" start. Swimmers will enter the water and swim to the end of the Lane 1, they will then swim under the lane line and crossover into the adjacent lane and swim back. At the end of each length swimmers MUST touch the wall (on the near side} and the rope lane (on the far side) BEFORE they can cross under the dividing lanes. Swimmers must swim the entire length of all six lanes to complete the 1/4 mile and will exit the water at the end of Lane 6 (on the same side of the pool in which you started).. Final swim instructions will be given during the pre-race briefing – pay attention!

- Wet suits are not allowed in the pool.
- Maximum time allowed for 1/4 mile swim is 15 minutes!
- Flip (racing) turns are not allowed. If you do a flip turn you will receive a two minute penalty for each flip turn.

BIKE COURSE: The 12 mile bike course consists of two loops of Central Park. Bikers will ride North from the transition area and circle the park in a counter-clockwise direction. Bikers must STAY in the middle and right hand lanes at ALL times and may not enter the runners (left) lane under ANY ircumstances!

Bikers must slow down, use caution and be prepared to stop when entering the transition area or when cycling on the narrow paths leading to and from the pool area.
. - Contestants are individually responsible for repair/maintenance of their bike.
- Bicycles placed on the wrong rack in the transition area will be removed.

CENTRAL PARK ALERT! The course is closed to cars but not to pedestrians, joggers, cyclists, skaters, etc. While biking, competitors must be aware and considerate of non-competitors who will also be sharing the Park roads with competitors. You do not have priority over other users of Central Park because you are competing in this event.

RECREATION LANE: The running/recreation lane, marked off with a solid double white line, is OFF LIMITS to cyclists. Competitors cycling in the recreation lane will be penalized two (2) minutes for each infraction. RUN COURSE: The 3 mile run is on the inner roadway of Central Park. Use caution and listen to the course marshals when starting the run. Runners leave the pool area and follow West Drive for 1.5 miles before turning around a large green cone and running back to the finish line at Lasker Pool.

TRANSITION AREA: Located at Lasker Pool. No friends, family or children will be allowed in pool area. Bicycles must be placed on assigned racks corresponding to race number. NO riding in the transition area or past the "DISMOUNT" signs at the entrance to the transition area. Bikes and equipment may be removed from the pool area upon showing corresponding run and bike numbers to security personnel. DRAFTING RULES: You must maintain a distance of at least three bike lengths from the bike in front of you! You may not be closer than this distance for any period exceeding 15 seconds. If you are, you will be assessed a two minute penalty for each violation.

HELMETS: Penalties will be assessed if cycling helmets are not positively secured with chin strap BEFORE entering/exiting the transition area. Helmets must be ANSI, SNELL, USCF or any other approved hard shell bicycle helmet..

===========================================================
RACE NUMBERS/ELECTRONIC TIMING:
On the morning of the race, you will pick up an electronic timing chip that corresponds to your assigned bib number. This chip must be attached with the velcro strap to your ankle.and must remain attached throughout the entire event.
You cannot use any chip other than the one that is assigned to you on the morning of the race. Wearing any other chip or wearing multiple chips could lead to errors in overall timing and your disqualification.
After you finish the event, you must remove the chip and drop it in the collection bin at the end of the timing chute.
voice.
Your bib number must be attached to the FRONT of your shirt (or race belt) during the entire race .
The 2-sided vinyl (adhesive-backed) bike frame number must be attached to the front of the top tube of your bicycle and for security reasons may not be removed until you leave the leave the transition area.
Check the label affixed to your race number for correct information regarding your name, age and sex.
Notify officials prior to the race of any mistakes!
=========================================================

RESULTS: Results will be posted on the New York Triathlon web site www.NYTRI.org.

POST-RACE: Award winners must be present at the post-race awards ceremony to claim their prize. PARKING: Central Park is closed to vehicular traffic on weekends. Recommended parking is on 5th Avenue, from 104th Street to 90th Street and along cross Streets.

Registration: http://www.nytc.org/calender.cfm

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
WHAT: Let's get together and take a trip to Centerport Long Island, home of the estate and Eagle’s Nest mansion of William Vanderbilt II
First we'll step back in time and tour the estate. The house is built like a Spanish or Mediterranean fortress with stucco reliefs and red tile roofs. The two large eagles at the entrance to the estate were taken from the original Grand Central Station, the columns come from the ancient ruins of Carthage, iron bell is brought from Russia, all pathways are made from Belgian block, spiked wooden gate are from medieval castle in France. 1000 year old mummy, of course came from Egypt. Also it contains many antique and organ. The Vanderbilts mansion is an example of the oppulence and promise of the time and a symbol of the success. This mansion has an authentic feel for the time period, it was created during the great industrial revolution of our nation's history. Definitely, this is a must see Gold Coast Mansion.
Also, we'll have a picnic on the beach, which is 15 minutes away from the mansion, and on the way back to the station we'll hike thru lovely Betty Allen Twin Ponds Nature Park or Edwin and Gertrude Grace nature preserve (the group will decide)
The pace of a hike is very moderate, there will be plenty of shades along the road and cool breeze from Centerport and Northport harbors. The hike will take place in Long Island. It's about 3 miles between described above places, plus we'll walk inside of landmark estate and gardens. It's a combination of walking, hiking and sightseeing.
Please note: This is rare opportunity to see what Golden cost has in store for us. Due to increasing taxes and maintenance, many of Grand estates were abandoned, vandalized and demolished. We have to rush to see and enjoy the remaining marvelous estates, which represent a bygone era of our past
Meeting at 8:15 AM on Sunday, July 26 at Long Island Rail Road Atlantic Station tickets booth.
The Atlantic Avenue Terminal is located across the street from the Williamsburg Savings Bank, the tallest building in Brooklyn which has a large clock on each side of its tower. You can take B, Q trains to Atlantic station or N, 2, 3, 4, 5 trains to Pacific station and walk toward LIRR ticket booth. I'll be waiting for you right there.
CONTACT: My phone:[masked]
COST: $20 for LIRR ticket.
$7 for Eagle nest mansion
$4 local cab
TRANSPORT: We will take Long Island Rail to Northport station. The departure of the train from Brooklyn ( Atlantic terminal) at 8:45A.M, Manhattan (Penn station) at 8:45AM, and Queens (Jamaica station) at 9:13.M. We’ll arrive to Northport station at 10:15A.M.
Please, wear the proper shoes and attire for a hike. (No high heels etc.) Please, bring water and bug repellent. Also, somewhere along the way, we'll have a picnic, so bring snacks or light picnic food.
results.name: Eagle nest mansion, Centerport beach, Edwin Grace Nature Preserve

results.description:
The Action is Back!

Legendary Action Park is Open for the Season! Extreme before extreme existed, you'll want to return for unique favorites like our famous Tarzan Swings, free-falling Cliff Jumps and the Colorado River Rapids - so wild helmets are required!

Can you handle Action Park? How about the World's TALLEST and ONLY double loping thrill slide! 
Imagine yourself standing 100 Feet in the air with a 50-mile view of New York then the trap door beneath your feet and you're a screaming ballistic super hero.

Old fans, new fans and those who've only heard about the breathtaking thrills of Action Park... THIS is your summer! Make your plans now....

For Safety, Code of Conduct & Weather Policy, please check the link here.

Depart 9:30 AM: (Garden City Deli) Northwest corner of West 43rd St. & 9th Ave, New York, NY 10036 (Map)

Return: Depart from Action Park around 7 PM & expect to be back in NYC at 8:30 PM and Flushing at 9:00 PM

Buy Ticket Here: http://aug2015actionpark.eventbrite.com/ or you can Chase Quickpay me the amount indicated above to [masked] to avoid transaction fee (How to Use Chase Quickpay?) Your spot is NOT confirmed until your payment is received.

* Full refund minus $10 processing fee if cancelled 10 days in advance;

* Afterward, no refund for cancellation or no show.

results.description:
**INDOOR, FUTSAL OR SNEAKERS**  

                               NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS!

         NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES 

                                      @ RIVERSIDE Park!

                             See our page on Facebook!:

                        ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RQxq4zYJDFg

DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

We'll play 3 simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check your email or our meetup message board on friday night or before 12.00pm on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field! Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

No power shots allowed. No power shots means; you can shoot the ball but not as hard as you can. This doesn't mean that you can not take the shot at all. Kicking the ball or taking the shot on the goal, is of course allowed.

If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.

Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game and maybe a two game ban.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Location:

Riverside Park at West 107 & 108 Street

Take the 1 RED Line Train to Cathedral Pkwy an walk two blocks down, to 108th Street and Riverside Dr.

The field is down the lower level near the river. You can easly access the field from 108th Street. Remember, the field is not visable from the street level, you have to walk down the stairs from Riverside Dr & 108th Street. and you will see the newly renovated fanced-in soccer field next to the river.

Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.


What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.25 when you RSVP. This $9.25 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to a local bar for brunch and a Pint or Two.

                                        Lion’s Head Tavern


                                     995 Amsterdam Ave

                                      New York, NY 10025

                                           (212)[masked]

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Register at: https://www.eventbrite.com/d/manhattan-biking/east-coast-greenway%27s-manhattan-loop-ride-2015/

Join us for a ride on the

EAST COAST GREENWAY

Manhattan Loop Ride

Sunday August 2,[masked]:00 AM

START: East River Greenway entrance @ 60 St. & York Ave. - meet at the lower dog run inside this entrance (62 street)

FINISH: East River Greenway @ E 34th St. & FDR Drive

Please join us for a 32-mile guided bike ride around Manhattan using the East and West Side Greenways. We start by heading up the East River Greenway past Roosevelt & Randall's Islands, through Inwood then over and south down the Hudson River Greenway passing the George Washington Bridge, the Intrepid and then all the way to Battery Park. The ride will proceed at an easy-going pace of 10 - 13 MPH. Please bring what you'll need such as water, snacks, a spare tire, and PLEASE wear a helmet. We usually ride rain or shine but if the weather is particularly unpleasant, you will receive a cancellation email by 7:00AM on the day of the ride. RIDE LEADERS: Anthony Savarese, and Scott Baker volunteers for the East Coast Greenway Alliance. For more information, contact me at [masked]

COST: To join this ride and any of the four rides scheduled by the East Coast Greenway Alliance in 2015, we request a $20 donation purchasing you an annual membership in the ECGA! This donation supports the ECGA's mission to create a 2,900 mile trail from Maine to Florida. Check out our website at www.greenway.org, we're well on our way there! The ECGA was founded in New York City in 1991.

The ECGA membership entitles you to join on all four rides scheduled this year! Please select the New Member outreach ticket option above. If you are already an ECGA member, you should select the ECGA member ticket and there is no required donation for the ride. For information about the ECGA NY Committee and its activities – including additional rides this season – visit www.greenway.org/ny1.php.

results.description:
Supposed to be another nice Summer day, so come out and play. Bring your racquet and some lightly used or new balls and we'll rally and play some doubles.

Weather: Check back for any cancellations due to poor weather or otherwise.

Transit: 6 train to last stop at Pelham Bay Park and short walk. BX5, BX12 and BX29 within walking distance.

• Court number/location will be announced in comments upon arrival.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.

Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned, permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

90min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank  
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

It is time to run this town again with another beautiful Runstreet Street Art Run! This time with special edition Runstreet Street Art Shirts!! The 5-mile easy paced run will be led by RRCA-certified running coach Marnie Kunz.

Meet at The Yoga Collective at 135 W. 29 Street for bag drop. We'll run the colorful streets of the East Village for a tour of some of the best NYC street art! The run will be at a relaxed pace to suit all levels and will include stops for a photo contest, and our talented photographer Marques Jackson from Filles + Garcons on the scene.

After the run we will enjoy some refreshing healthy hydration at The Yoga Collective and unwind with special Restorative Yoga for Runners, taught by Yoga Instructor, Running Coach and The Yoga Collective owner Michele Favale. Tickets available here! http://www.eventbrite.com/e/runstreet-street-art-run-runners-yoga-tickets-17538845158?aff=mcivte

Early registration guarantees your shirt size and entry! For same-day entries, it'll be $30 cash at the door.
results.name: Runstreet Street Art Run + Runners Yoga + Shirts!

results.description:
Winner stays, guys!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3XviR7esUvo

And just in case anyone needs a refresher, some guidance from Coach Ted Lasso.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6KeG_i8CWE8

No refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before you RSVP.

Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. Pass the ball to your teammates and have a good time. NO rough playing, slide tackling, or screaming at others will be tolerated. You'll be removed from the game immediately.

No cleats are allowed. Let's do our part to preserve the field. Turf or running shoes are recommended.

Always bring a *dark and white* t-shirt

Be on time.

Teams are broken out ahead of each game based on skill level. Beginner, intermediate, and advanced players are all encouraged to join.

We play THREE, 25-30 minute games with a brief break between each game.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.
