6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

results.description:
Hi Ladies,

We are back after a short reprieve, let's meet and walk the Highline before it gets packed with tourists. There is one caveat this time, we are going to walk the length of the High line and back. ( we start and end at the Gansvoort Street entrance  in order to qualify for a brunch reservation)

So here's the deal:

Let's gather at 10;45 am sharp at the Washington/Gansevoort st entrance .

We will then walk the HighLine to the end and back (power walk, run, or leisurely walk). and we all will meet  back at the starting point at 12:15. and walk to our brunch destination.

We will be enjoying brunch at Fig and Olive Restaurant in the Meatpacking
district located at 420 West 13th Street between 9th Ave and Washington St. for a 12:30 reservation. http://www.figandolive.com/menu/meatpacking/


The restaurant can accommodate 14 people on this day. We will be seated at the community table and there will be others seated at the other end that are not part of our group. I checked out about 8 restaurants in the area and all of them need deposits, or need a prixe fix menu commitment..


This is the only way we can avoid an advance deposit, and a limited brunch menu.


I am limiting the rsvps to the first 14 who wish to go to brunch,

Once we hit 14 rsvps for the walk AND brunch, I will open up the  RSVPS to all who wish to join for the walk, and who are not joining us for brunch, OR for those who wish to be waitlisted.

Please comment, along with your RSVP so I know which category you falll in:

Either walk and brunch, or just the walk, or the walk plus waitlisted.( there is no option to  just come to brunch, sorry with


So ladies, please change your RSVP to NO, if you have a change of plans once you have RSVP'd so that a waitlisted person can attend..

Should be a great day to make new friends, or catch up with old friends.

Those who are not  a part of the 12 of us going to Fig and Olive, can still make their own arrangements to go for brunch afterwards,

I look forward to catching up with everyone soon,

There will be a hat passed before the walk begins, for a $1, 2, or 3 dollar donation, to keep meetup.com alive, so we can continue to have meetups.

Cheers,

Carly


The entrance to the  Highline where we are meeting is near the Standard Hotel and the Whitney Musuem.. On Gansevoort Street and Washington Street.

This is the furthest south you can enter the Highline from the street.

Call me if you are running late. We will gather at 10:45 to meet and greet and wait until 11am sharp to begin walking.  My cell # is[masked]-1745.

I opened up the RSVP's for the Highline walk up to the time of the event., Brunch reservations are full.

The weather is supposed to be awesome.!

Wear comfortable shoes, and bring your shades!

See your smiling faces tomorrow.:)

Let's get this party started ...woohoo!!


Carly
results.name: Walk the Highline and Back and have brunch at Fig and Olive Rest/Meatpacking

Needed:  Last month we fed about 42, these qty's/menu work for a group that size.  4-5 pounds of meat (chop meat, sausage etc.
5 pounds (boxes) pastaPasta Sauce (large jars)  5-10 depending on sizeFrozen veggies, (one or two very large bags)
SaladDessert  (Irene is bringing her outstanding dessert!)
Father Daniel Berrigan, S.J. wrote: Sometime in your life, hope that you might see one starved person, the look on his face when the bread finally arrives. Hope that you might have baked it or bought or even kneaded it yourself. For that look on his face, for your meeting his eyes across a piece of bread, you might be willing to lose a lot, or suffer a lot, or even die a little.


RSVP please, so we can provide a complete meal!

Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:
If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Paul

results.description:
This run will be beginner-friendly, but we welcome runners at all levels. We will be running anywhere from 2 - 6ish miles depending on what everyone is looking to do. 

The main starting point will be at Columbus Circle by the gold statue (not the silver unisphere).

Here are some options:

Advanced: 
6 miles: Lots of hills. Run along the full outer loop of the park. The hills are more challenging if you run counter-clockwise. 

Intermediate: 
~5 miles: Run along the outer loop but cut across the 102nd st traverse.  You'll skip the infamous Harlem hill.

Beginner: 
1.7 miles: Run around the lower loop. Cut across the 72st traverse and hang a left again once you hit the west side, end back at Columbus Circle.

If possible we will break into pace groups, but either way lets meet back at the USS Maine Monument around 12-12:15am.

Where do I leave my stuff? 
The New York Running Company at the Time Warner Center (located on the 2nd floor) has open bins, and lockers behind the cash register. To use the lockers, you must bring your own lock. They also have changing rooms. These services are free. The New York Running Company opens at 11am on Sunday. 

What time does the run actually start?
Plan on arriving at 11am, but we won't start running until about 11:15am in case people need to change or drop off their stuff at the NY Running Company. We will not wait longer that 11:15am.  

What happens after the run?
After the run once everyone is together again, we can grab some food! Weather permitting, we can get something to eat from Whole Foods (or wherever you like), and we can sit and eat in the park. We can walk over to the Sheep Meadow.
If the weather is not picnic-friendly, we can hit our goto place which is Cosmic Diner on 52nd and 8th ave. Hot chocolate, coffee, pancakes? Mmmm.. If anyone wants to suggest a different place that is close by, we're flexible.


Call/text Henry at (646)[masked] if you have any questions or are having trouble finding us.

Dig deep and drag yourself out to go for a run! You'll be glad you did!

** only RSVP 'No' if you were previously a 'Yes'.

results.description:
This will be the first official StoryForward NYC event and we hope to make it a smashing success. We are charging a nominal fee to help us cover some of the costs of food and beverage to be served during the networking portion of the event. 

About the seminar:

"Inside the Art of Visual Storytelling"

Screenwriter, teacher and former Marvel Comics Executive Editor Carl Potts will discuss how to combine instinct with an intellectual approach to arrive at the best visual narrative solutions for your story. All sequential visual media combine three major creative elements: Narrative, Visuals and Sequential Visual Storytelling. 

This seminar covers all three elements, with an emphasis on the basic principles and techniques of sequential visual storytelling  ̶  the art at the heart of all sequential visual media.

About the speaker:

For most of his 13 years at Marvel Entertainment, Carl Potts was an Executive Editor, in charge of the creative, editorial and cross-media IP development for a third of the company's publications. He went on to work as a Creative Director in online gaming and interactive marketing, including a stint as Sr. Creative Director in AGENCY.COM's NYC office. Carl has written screenplays covering a wide range of genres and subjects. Jerry Bruckheimer Films bought Carl's Alien Legion screenplay. The script is based on the Alien Legion comics series originally published by Marvel's creator-owned Epic imprint. An adjunct professor at School of Visual Arts and Academy of Art University, Carl teaches undergraduate and graduate level sequential visual storytelling classes. His book, The DC Comics Guide to Creating Comics: Inside the Art of Visual Storytelling, was published by Watson-Guptill/Random House.

Event details:


11:00 - 11:15 - Doors open/ Networking

11:15 - 12:15 - Seminar

12:15 - 12:30 - Q&A

12:30 - 1:30PM - Networking/ Cocktails

results.description:
These 12 short moving qigong come directly from the original Wutang Shan martial tradition, specifically (like everything else in the internal martial arts) from the 12 Qi Disruption Methods, which is from where everything in the Chinese internal martial arts stem. Each main channel has a specific qigong form that will work on the organ/meridian function, and its Shen function as well. They also train the practitioner on how to work on qi emission through the hands, both for medical and self-defense purposes. Information will be given on when is the best time to practice these forms, and to know which one to choose and do at any given time.

Note:
These series of free classes are intended to show the both sides of the original Yang style: the ‘softer’ and internal, and the ‘harder/martial’ and external. It will also elucidate the link between the both sides of the same coin - fajing. On one side, we train it slowly, in order to train the subconscious on how to recover that natural expression of energy, and to impart it with some sophistication that makes it more suitable for our higher-goals: self-healing and medical (healing others) work. On the other, we train on how to use it for self-defense purposes, and on how it can help give us the best chance of survival when our life is in true danger.

results.description:
Hunger and Poverty in the Bronx: Part of the Solution (POTS)

Speaker: Magdelene Boon, POTS

Details: Join Part of the Solution in a discussion about poverty and food insecurity in our own backyard. In 2014, struck by the rapid growth in demand for services, POTS decided to study poverty both within the community it serves and throughout the Bronx. They will share their findings and discuss steps that we (as individuals, as a Society) can take to end hunger and create a more ethical community in the Bronx.

Our Sunday collection will be shared with POTS.

About POTS: Helping low-income families and individuals since 1982, Part of the Solution (POTS) has grown to become a leading provider of emergency food, social services and legal representation in the Bronx. POTS’ ‘one-stop shop’ design will assist more than 25,000 individuals, including 8,000 children, as they move from crisis to stability and, ultimately, self-sufficiency this year alone.  Currently, services include a Community Dining Room, open seven days a week; a Food Pantry; Clothing Room, Shower, and Mail Facilities; Barbershop; Case Management to help people address barriers to stability; a Legal Clinic specializing in eviction prevention and improper denial of benefits; and the POTS Family Club, to provide comprehensive case management, education, social and nutrition support to a select group of families. POTS also holds a variety of seasonal distributions for items such as back-to-school supplies, Thanksgiving turkeys, and holiday gifts and is host to Immigrant Justice Corps Fellows to offer immigration services and a Medical and Dental Clinic.

Sunday programs are held at 11:00 AM at the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. For more information, please visit our website: <a>http://www.rysec.org</a>;

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

results.description:
For the first time I'm offering a free public tour of a Food Forest Garden I began in 2011 on a smallish suburban lot. It has over 3 dozen fruiting trees and shrubs like Seckel Pear and jostaberries plus dozens more of interesting plant (and animal) species like Sea Kale and Chinese Yams. As far as I know, there's nothing quite like it on Long Island. It's only 35 minutes by train from Penn Station. Go to this link to see some pictures taken in May: https://www.flickr.com/gp/125398855@N02/6053nk
Please RSVP here https://www.facebook.com/events/1603689743228642/
results.name: Long Island Food Forest Garden Tour

Each week, they choose several books from their shelves (based on the age of the children attending) and sit down with the children and parents for a good, old-fashioned, storytime. It's a fun-filled time for all!


This event is FREE.

This is a wonderful way to get story time in with your lil' one (especially for the working mommies) with a variety of books that you may not have in your own child's library at home.

NOTE:  Our weekends tend to fill up quite a bit, but I will make a notation in the event listing if I plan to attend with my lil' one.  Otherwise, please feel free to use the comment section to meet up with other mommies in the group.

results.description:
Join us at the Uncommons gaming cafe in the Village for our weekly event full of fun and games! The store charges $5 cover for the day. We stay all day, come and go at any time.


The Uncommons has this huge stock of games available for play. Or bring your own. No experience is necessary, we're always happy to teach anything.

What do we play? Some of everything. Some complex modern collecting and building games, like Ticket to Ride or Settlers of Catan.

Some of the classics, like Monopoly or Scrabble or Clue.

And some silly card games, like Cards Against Humanity or Twilight Sparkle's Shipfic Folder or the always entertaining Pony Races.

Whatever kinds of games you like, we'll be playing something that you'll find fun!

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 11:30 am to 1:30 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).
Every third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.
This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
Anniversary-01-Version Fun & Games MeetUp!...


Please RSVP (or update your RSVP) asap!... Thank you!

Note: Confirmed by the Park & Rec Dept. (the reason that I don't have a location is that, they lost the original application & in the past week, the person in charge has left early two of the days including today, and apparently doesn't work Wed.) So I have a letter of Authorization for Milton Votee Park.

Welcome back Fun Gamers!

First, thank you all for joining our MeetUp Group, "Fun & Games!"...

Finally, here's "mostly" the details for the 1 Year Anniversary -- things are just a bit slower with making reservations here in Northern NJ... we're confirmed on the day...

• Sunday 02 Aug

• Final Location Milton Votee Park (in Teaneck off Rt4)

• Note: Confirmed by the Park & Rec Dept. (the reason that I don't have a location is that, they lost the original application & in the past week, the person in charge has left early two of the days including today, and apparently doesn't work Wed.) So I have a letter of Authorization for Milton Votee Park.

• 11:30 AM (if you want to help with setup & I'll give extra F&G Points)

• 12 Noon Start Time TO 3:30 PM

• $5 per person* + Pot Luck Sign-Up

• Please use the comments to help coordinate what you plan to bring for the Pot Luck (or if you'd just like to contribute some extra money, in addition to the $5 for the event.)


• All F&G Points will be awarded at the 1st Anniversary will be doubled!


* - Note: Unlike almost all of the events we've had... there is a small charge for this, because the city charges us (unless we've a Teaneck resident who wants to replace me on the sign-up, then maybe it'd be free?) I don't feel $5 is that much (and if we get 20 people to come, the group doesn't have to pay.) That being said, if you really can't afford it, please come anyway! Just PM me in advance so I know, that's all I ask, & I'll put you on the list as pre-paid.

I think our new New Social Games Initiative & Monthly Game Spotlight is continuing to be a success on both regards... Here's what we have this week:

• Social Game - WereWolf - Hosted by Sarah ... WereWolf for the social game... I prefer "teams" for the social game; and someone had a suggestion last week, but noone replied to my comment from last week...

• Monthly Game Spotlight - to be announce by George at the picnic

Please help us grow!... please share our group on Google+ & Facebook!

There are "high-res" photos available if you want to print a flyer for work and/or school!

(-: New Social Games Initiative & "Monthly" Game Spotlight! ;-)


Yes, yes, yes... always changing, always trying to improve... for the next few month's we're going to try changing our "Weekly" Game Spotlight, to a "Monthly" Game Spotlight... July's GotM > MtG

New Updates -

Game Tracking will start this week with MtG & our Social Game -- earn F&G points towards our awards night! You get F&G points just for playing the games & you get bonus F&G points for being based on how you play in MtG and whether or not you're on the winning team for the social game!

Next week -- we'll not only have game tracking, but event & new ppl tracking... earn F&G points, just for showing up & playing one game... also, earn F&G points for bringing someone new. :-)

Congratulations Everyone for making Fun & Games a success!!!

I think our new New Social Games Initiative & Monthly Game Spotlight is continuing to be a success on both regards... Here's what we have this week:


• Social Game - Word Game - Hosted by George


• Monthly Game Spotlight - MtG - Hosted by George & Cemre


Please feel free to PM me about this and/or anything else regarding Fun & Games MeetUp!

See you at 4PM on Sunday!

There will be more 2015 changes/details to come, but I wanted to let you know there's a lot more to come in 2015!!!


Do you want a teaser?...

• We'll start our player / game tracking in 2015! ... and at our 2015 Holiday Party, we'll give out awards for various categories! (It's only about 336 days away, but I wanted to give you time to prepare... :-P)


Thanks & hope to see you there!

George

a.k.a. Jorge Loco

PS RSVP isn't required, but it'll definitely help me out!

PPS Shall we play a game?

results.description:
#SCNYC goes to Boogie on the Boulevard: Summer Sundays!

Meet us at Frederick Douglass Circle for a quick ride over to Boogie on the Boulevard Summer Sundays!

We will celebrate summer in the Bronx on the Grand Concourse between 161st and 167th Streets. The center lanes will be closed to cars and open to a world of fun, with free music, activities and programs hosted by art/cultural, civic, health organizations and artists. For details go to http://www.bronxmuseum.org/events/boogie-on-the-boulevard-summer-sundays_3 

We will do our best to stick together and always get a volunteer to ride as sweep but please have someone’s number to call if you get separated from the group. There are a few stretches where everyone will be invited to pedal at their preferred pace and mass up points will be called out along the route…so grab your bike and bring your friends!

WHEN: Meet up at 12:00 Noon, Wheels down at 12:15 pm!

MEET-UP: Frederick Douglass Circle, New York, NY 10026
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Frederick_Douglass_Circle

END SPOT: Joyce Kilmer Park, Walton Avenue, Bronx, NY 10452

http://www.nycgovparks.org/parks/joyce-kilmer-park


ROUTE: http://tinyurl.com/qj4t4lq

</a>
DISTANCE: <4 Miles


Ever endeavoring to turn social cyclists into cycling commuters.
The goals are to ride bikes and hang out with friends that love riding bikes.

Feel free to contact us with any questions/concerns.
[masked]

CAUTION: If you like to ride ahead of the lead, please be sure to test the route for your own safety and for the safety of anyone that doesn't know the route and follows you. Feel free to ride ahead on bridges as we always mass up on the other side.

WHAT YOU NEED:

NYC Department of Transportation Bicycle Laws, Rules & Regulations require: White headlight and red taillight must be used from dusk to dawn, bell or other audible signal (not whistle), working brakes, and reflective tires and/or other reflective devices.

Social Cycling NYC strongly recommends that every cyclist: Follows NYC DOT rules, EXPECTS all cyclists to accept personal responsibility for their own actions (or lack thereof), and recommends cyclists bring/use bikes, helmets, locks, IDs, money for food and drinks, and cycling friends!

HOW: WE ride AS traffic and NOT AGAINST it. We stop at red lights, yield the right of way and let cars pass as best we can. We don't block intersections. We are nice to both our fellow riders and the other traffic on the road. LISTEN TO the volunteers helping to lead the ride. They are some nice people and have your best interests in mind. If you have any questions about the rules, please check here: <a href="http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6">http://www.nyc.gov/html/look/html/cyclist/cyclist_safety_text.shtml#sec6

REMINDER: The goal is to create a safe environment for all riders, but we cannot control, nor do we desire to, every rider's behavior. We promote personal responsibility and all riders are responsible for themselves. If you choose to ride with us, then you accept the risks inherent in riding a bicycle with a large group of other people riding bicycles.

Social Cycling New York City is modeled after Social Cycling Austin.https://www.facebook.com/socialcyclingaustin/info
results.how_to_find_us: In the middle of the traffic circle next to the statue of Frederick Douglass
results.name: #SCNYC goes to Boogie on the Boulevard: Summer Sundays

results.description:
August 2nd

12 Noon

The incredible Brunch @ Berimbau Do Brasil, 43 Carmine St, New York, NY 10014  b/t Bedford St & Bleecker St , West Village

Movie:" Phoenix" at the 

IFC Center,  323 6th Ave. at W 3rd St., New York, NY 10014 

SHOWTIME:  3:10 PM....TRY AND GET TICKETS ON LINE!!!

Plot Summary 

A spellbinding mystery of identity, illusion, and deception unfolds against the turmoil of post-World War II Germany in the stunning new film from acclaimed director Christian Petzold (Barbara, Jerichow). Nelly (Nina Hoss), a German-Jewish nightclub singer, has survived a concentration camp, but with her face disfigured by a bullet wound. After undergoing reconstructive surgery, Nelly emerges with a new face, one similar but different enough that her former husband, Johnny (Ronald Zehrfeld), doesn’t recognize her. Rather than reveal herself, Nelly walks into a dangerous game of duplicity and disguise as she tries to figure out if the man she loves may have been the one who betrayed her to the Nazis. Evoking the shadows and haunted mood of post-war Berlin, Phoenix weaves a complex tale of a nation’s tragedy and a woman’s search for answers as it builds towards an unforgettable, heart-stopping climax.

Cast: Nina Hoss , Ronald Zehrfeld , Nina Kunzendorf ,Michael Maertens , Imogen Kogge , Felix Römer , Uwe Preuss , Valerie Koch

Director: Christian Petzold

Genres: Historical drama

Distributor: IFC Films

REVIEWS

RogerEbert.comBrian TallericoJul 24,[masked]A film this satisfying on every level — one that can be enjoyed purely for its narrative while also providing material for hours of discussion on its themes — is truly rare.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewNew York PostFarran Smith NehmeJul 23,[masked]More than a thriller, Phoenix is a ghost story, made plain in an extraordinary shot of Nelly’s terror at a passing train.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe A.V. ClubA.A. DowdJul 22,[masked]For what it sets out to accomplish, across a brisk 98 minutes, Petzold’s film feels perfectly judged. And it builds to an ending that’s just plain perfect.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewGet a FiOS package that's made for streaming.Equip your apartment with FiOS QuantumSM 50/50 Mbps Internet, FiOS TV Local & your choice of HBO® or SHOWTIME® for 2 yrs. with No Annual Contract.Sponsored by Verizon FiOSVillage VoiceStephanie ZacharekJul 21,[masked]The director's last film was the superb 2012 Barbara, also starring Hoss and Zehrfeld, another romance with a mystery built in; Phoenix is an even finer piece of work, so beautifully made that it comes close to perfect.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewSlant MagazineJames LattimerJul 19,[masked]Christian Petzold never luxuriates in all this film history, but rather channels the artifice and affect it embodies into new insights.All this publication's reviewsRead full reviewThe Hollywood ReporterJordan MintzerSep 14,[masked]Both a powerful allegory for post-war regeneration and a rich Hitchcockian tale of mistaken identity, Phoenix once again proves that German filmmaker Christian Petzold and his favorite star, Nina Hoss, are clearly one of the best director-actor duos working in movies today.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewindieWIREEric KohnSep 14,[masked]Hoss' portrayal of a woman at odds with her surroundings is in a class by itself.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe PlaylistNikola GrozdanovicSep 14,[masked]Petzold distills a familiar atmosphere to create a work veiled in vibrant, cohesive, sensitively stimulating power.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewNew York Magazine (Vulture)David EdelsteinJul 24,[masked]A haunting, morbidly romantic melodrama with obvious links to "Vertigo," but from a reverse angle.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewVarietyScott FoundasJan 13,[masked]Because Petzold is such a gifted storyteller, with the lean, driving narrative sense of the film noir masters, he also keeps those twists and turns chugging smoothly along, building to a climax so expertly orchestrated that one imagines he started with it in mind and worked the rest of the movie backward from there.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe Globe and Mail (Toronto)Nathalie AtkinsonMay 7,[masked]With a riveting performance-within-a-performance of subtle physicality by Nina Hoss, the charade in which a woman plays her own doppelganger certainly borrows tension, look and conventions from postwar film noir.All this publication's reviewsRead full reviewEntertainment WeeklyJoe McGovernJul 23,[masked]The plot is just implausible enough to keep the film from greatness, but director Christian Petzold (Barbara) stirs up a powder-keg metaphor about rebuilding after war.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe New York TimesA.O. ScottJul 23,[masked]Never less than intriguing, coolly intelligent and flawlessly paced, Phoenix often feels trapped in the logic of its conceit.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewThe GuardianRyan GilbeyJul 21,[masked]It’s a testament to Petzold’s sane head, steady hand and effortless storytelling skill that implausible plot-points are smuggled past us in their own blood-soaked bandages.All this publication's reviewsRead full reviewTime Out LondonCath ClarkeJul 21,[masked]It works and then some, making for a noirish and complex emotional thriller. And Hoss is incredible, playing Nelly with the shuffling gait and haunted expression of a dead woman walking.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewEmpireDavid ParkinsonMay 5,[masked]A gripping study of treachery, identity and survival.All this critic's reviewsRead full reviewCineVueJohn BleasdaleSep 14,[masked]Petzold's Phoenix is a high-concept premise executed as a heart-wrenching character piece.

results.description:
Whether you are visiting our beautiful city, coming from a lesson, or just have the day off...come on out and hit with us! We are a group of tennis enthusiast of 2.5 to 4.0 levels that have the fundamental parts of the game down and like to hit against different styles of play.


WHY PLAY HERE?

Well, first of all it is a nice serene location (i.e. no basketball courts, grandstands, or any other type of distraction). Secondly, consider the cost options to play else elsewhere in-and-around the city...


1) unless you have endless tennis competitors on your roll-a-dex, you'll need a web-based database/system to find people. Most of these tennis databases/systems charge in different ways. Fact, Meetup charges me a premium every month because of the member pool size and this has to be  prepaid just to keep the group alive.

2) if you play elsewhere, you will need a permit which will currently cost you $15 for a single day (or $200 for a yearly). To be more specific, these two options really only entitle you to one hour of singles play (vs. 2 hours here), meaning your partner will also need a permit.

3) new balls are provided at the beginning of each day. Typical extra-duty balls run about $3 per can off-the-shelf, so if you are an avid player...you'll save time and money running around picking-up tennis balls.

4) if someone were to break a string, or you just want to try a different racquet for an evaluation (i.e. lighter weight, bigger head, tighter strings, etc), racquets are available at no addition cost.

5) seasonally "clean" courts. Throughout the year tennis courts pile up with blowing leaves, pollen, acorns, etc. I get here early every session to ensure the courts are clean. I do this with a battery-powered blower and if any body knows anything about batteries...its that they don't last! Each time I have to replace one (which only does one court), it cost me nearly $100 for each.

6) portions of fee here actually go repairing the courts and/or nets. Case-and-point the cement required to fill cracks which was recently done by myself.

7) there are port-a-potty's and 2 drinking fountains available for all to use

8) no dress code required like some places...but proper edict is appreciated


9) based on the talent that signup, I may ask people to move around to establish a competitive session for all those involved


Hopefully this addresses all those questions like: is it free or why does it cost.

WAYS TO RSVP...

Within Meetup, just click RSVP for the time slot that works best with your schedule and be resposible to attend. You can prepay (eliminating the need to remember to carry cash) a number of ways:

Reserve via PayPal ([masked]) vs. cash and select friends (not service) to avoid additional PayPal fees

OR

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916


2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 session = $25; Use Promo Code = T15TS1 

3 sessions @ $20 = $60; Use Promo Code = T15TS3 

6 sessions @ $17 = $102; Use Promo Code = T15TS6 

10 sessions @ $15 = $150; Use Promo Code = T15TS10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance

WEATHER

Weather is always an unpredictable thing but remember, just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers...that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area, but not where the courts are. Lastly, if it does sprinkle...we have the necessary equipment to dry them.

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

DIRECTIONS

We are directly south of the George Washington Bridge right on the Hudson River. Best ways to get there are A train, M4 or M98 bus, biking along the river or driving and parking on Riverside Drive behind the Presbyterian hospital (being the less favorite).

http://www.google.com/maps/@40.8494798,-73.9430776,16z?hl=en

(walking via 181 street subway stop)

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station (sit in the back of the train).

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, on Riverside Drive to the light green Pedestrian Crossover Bridge.

4. Cross the pedestrian bridge and follow the ramp down proceeding toward the GW Bridge which zigzags (crossing over the railroad tracks), and down the hill.

5. Arrive at the courts on your left.

Please plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule delays and note its takes an additional 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to the courts, so please arrive before scheduled slot so everyone can start on time.

<a href="http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc"></a>

Join us for an afternoon of dark, challenging conversation and crappy food.

Bring a skeptical, nihilistic topic of your own, and/or one or more sick jokes.

Topics will range from Schopenhauer’s pessimism, David Benatar’s anti-natalism, and Donald Trump’s hair to the Panera menu and current restroom cleanliness.

We will meet in the back NEXT TO the big room. The big room has been reserved by, I assume, the SHAMANIC HYPNOTHERAPISTS AND PAST-LIFE REGRESSION NUDNIKS OF BERGEN COUNTY Meetup group. Or the BERGEN COUNTY MONSTER TRUCK SOCIETY. Something really high-end, in any case.

Leave your tinfoil hats at home. Berets are optional.

results.description:
Updated August 2nd, 2015

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

SPRING/SUMMER (Mar - Aug)

As the city warms up we play four times a week. We use Riverside Park on Tuesdays/Thursdays and Morningside Park for the weekend games.

There are four days that we play:

- Saturdays at 10am, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Sundays at 12pm, Morningside Park (110th and Manhattan Ave)
- Tuesdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)
- Thursdays at 6pm, Riverside Park (103rd and West End - Where we can!)

Damien
[masked]


MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the B or C local to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

We are going Back to Nature!

We have been tour!

Now we are returning to The Museum of Natural History. Every Month. Same Time. Same place. Until further notice.

Our monthly Museum Walk and Talk is still the first Sunday of every month! Same time at 1pm under the lobby dinos (at or near...they did some renovations...). At 1:30 we move to the downstairs cafe to nosh and chat. Then we start exploring at 2:30. I usually have a blue New York Atheists hat on and a small brights button.

Generally, we try to keep it cheap and educational. The Museum of Natural History's admission is by donation.


Bright Cheers Evolving (BCE),
Charlie [masked], mobile)
Acting Director of The New York Brights

 

"In general people are not born stupid. True stupidity
is achieved only through great effort, such as the Creation Museum in Petersburg, KY"

Again, ANBU-TRU is a registry for groups (individuals may sign up as official liaisons and tell their respective groups about it)

There is no formal meeting yet. We explore parallel to The Brights and The Guardians. Just write me for info.

results.description:
LOCATION : please note, we will meet in BRYANT PARK, in close proximity of the Carousal, unless there's inclement weather, in which case, we will meet in the lobby area of the Royalton Hotel (opposite the chimney).


ASSIGNMENT :  "NOTES from The UNDERGROUND"

Author : Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Arguably one of the greatest novelists in history, Fyodor Dostoevsky is especially notable for interweaving deep philosophical, psychological and theological threads into his brilliant fiction. As a result, his works become much more than stimulating, entertaining stories but actual representation of 19th century intellectual history. This can not be any more true for his most philosophical work of all, Notes from Underground. Notes is Dostoevsky's groundbreaking philosophical prologue to his later novels, and it wrestles with modern existential questions which deal with Man's role in a world where the idea of God was being rejected more and more.
The Enlightenment of the 17th and 18th centuries espoused the value of reason, proclaimed the potential improvement of Man and Society, and freed humanity from superstition. By the 19th century, with the belief in God declining, Dostoevsky saw mankind having lost its moral bearing, wafting directionless in the tempest that is life. Instead of liberating Man for the better, the Enlightenment had renounced his spiritual connection. Where Dostoevsky saw a creature of God, his contemporary philosophers were seeking a new definition of modern man, out from under the definition of God.
Notes provides a greater perspective in European thought. The 19th century was characterized by a brutal polarization of existential thinking in which there was no synthesis. Dostoevsky and Friedrich Nietzsche epitomize this philosophical schism: at one end, Dostoevsky calls for Man to embrace faith and Christian morality; at the other stands Nietzsche, rejecting religion as unnatural and entreating Man to transgress contemporary moral values. By the turn of the century, Man and God were still as much a mystery as before, and so remain.
In Notes, Dostoevsky shows us the Underground Man, a despicable and pitiable creature who betrays himself and is not even aware of it. He is the creation of a thoroughly anti-modern author imploring his fellow Russians to resign from the West.


NOTE : When possible, please donate ~$3 @ meet-ups, to help with Meet-up.com fees.

This event is a free-form, roundtable discussion and I ask that members come prepared with passages or themes from the reading(s) that they wish to discuss with the group so that the conversation will include and focus on that which grabbed us each with the greatest force.

results.description:
Hi everyone!!! :)

Hope you are having a lovely Friday! 

Confirming our next meet up for Sunday, August 2. 

In the last meet up we got to know each other and talk about our own meaning and understanding of basic concepts in Abraham's teachings. Everyone took something home to practice which we will share in this new meet up.

This time we can go a little deeper and start bringing more clarity to some of the group's questions about the teachings. We have co-created a very knowledgeable group :) ... now it is a matter of putting all that knowledge into practice so all our realities can bring everything we want. 

Just remember that we are all mirrors of each other, everyone of us will have something of us to bring more awareness too ourselves, to know more about ourselves. So knowledge alone is not enough, others can bring us the gift of that which we cannot see, we cannot understand... can help us see those patterns of thoughts that are keeping us in a never ending cycle. And that is the intention of this group :) ... for all of us to gain more clarity about what we know and be able to little by little raise our frequency so that we can eventually match that of our Vortex, where we have that higher version of ourselves. And as a group, become a stronger higher consciousness unity that can inspire others to do the same... and that is how I believe that we can co-create a better world!

Have an amazing weekend!

Andrea

results.description:
Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of Union Square.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  


• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

results.description:
There is always high demand for figure sessions, but I don't have the time to organize more. So my friend (artist extraordinaire) Simon has offered to host some weekly sessions. These events won't impact the regular schedule of the group; they're additional. Hope to see you there! - Jesse

Join us for Saturday figure sketching, at a beautiful space conveniently located in Union Square! We'll be in Suite 505.

Unlike our outdoor Meetups, this one costs money so we can pay for the space and models. It's $15 per person, pay at the door. These sessions tend to be in high demand, so only RSVP if you are pretty sure you will attend! If not, please open the spot for someone else.

Any problems on the day of the event, Simon can be reached at [masked]. 

Looking forward to sketching with you!


What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!


• We sketch for a bit, and then take a break and share our drawings. Then we sketch some more, etc.

• Feel free to bring any media you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos (not of the model) to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• The event will last three hours.

• Everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to the attending list.


Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)

results.description:
LOCATION : please note, we will meet in BRYANT PARK, in close proximity of the Carousal, unless there's inclement weather in which case, we will meet in the lobby area of the Royalton Hotel (opposite the chimney).

READING ASSIGNMENT :  "NOTES from The UNDERGROUND"

Author : Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Arguably one of the greatest novelists in history, Fyodor Dostoevsky is especially notable for interweaving deep philosophical, psychological and theological threads into his brilliant fiction. As a result, his works become much more than stimulating, entertaining stories but actual representation of 19th century intellectual history. This can not be any more true for his most philosophical work of all, Notes from Underground. Notes is Dostoevsky's groundbreaking philosophical prologue to his later novels, and it wrestles with modern existential questions which deal with Man's role in a world where the idea of God was being rejected more and more.
The Enlightenment of the 17th and 18th centuries espoused the value of reason, proclaimed the potential improvement of Man and Society, and freed humanity from superstition. By the 19th century, with the belief in God declining, Dostoevsky saw mankind having lost its moral bearing, wafting directionless in the tempest that is life. Instead of liberating Man for the better, the Enlightenment had renounced his spiritual connection. Where Dostoevsky saw a creature of God, his contemporary philosophers were seeking a new definition of modern man, out from under the definition of God.
Notes provides a greater perspective in European thought. The 19th century was characterized by a brutal polarization of existential thinking in which there was no synthesis. Dostoevsky and Friedrich Nietzsche epitomize this philosophical schism: at one end, Dostoevsky calls for Man to embrace faith and Christian morality; at the other stands Nietzsche, rejecting religion as unnatural and entreating Man to transgress contemporary moral values. By the turn of the century, Man and God were still as much a mystery as before, and so remain.
In Notes, Dostoevsky shows us the Underground Man, a despicable and pitiable creature who betrays himself and is not even aware of it. He is the creation of a thoroughly anti-modern author imploring his fellow Russians to resign from the West.

results.name: Dostoevsky's "Notes from the Underground"

results.description:
Please join us in August for a roofdeck meetup event in Brooklyn Heights.


Summer is a great time to visit Arlene Stimmel's deck on Atlantic Avenue in Brooklyn Heights. All the evergreens are exuberant. Lots of annuals this year, the salvias are all doing great, some new perennials, All the houseplants enjoying their summer vacation. 

 Arlene has a nice selection of variegated plants and trees and a comfortable, large, elegant and pretty deck.  Her coniferous trees are especially nice, with high grasses and houseplants that will eventually have to be put inside over the winter.  The deck has great seating areas to relax and chat. 

Food/snacks/drinks always welcome - World Famous Sahadis food emporium is right down the block (excellent middle eastern foods).

STAIRS:  There are about 20 stairs to get to Arlenes Apt, then a circular stairway to get to the roofdeck

From the roofdeck, I think you can see the East River and Staten Island. 

Come early to Brooklyn Heights and stroll down Henry or Pierrepont sts to see all the beautiful houses, or head to nearby Brooklyn Promenade to view the Manhattan skyline. The entire experience will land you in an interesting and scenic part of the city. If you're traveling by subway, lots of choices--2,3,4,5,R to Borough Hall. Very close to Manhattan, in fact just across the water. If you're driving, it's easy to park . So come and join us.

Arlene's cell phone:[masked]


Directions:

Location-141 Atlantic Ave (between Clinton and Henry, above the store Modular R). It's the red door on the left.

directions-Take the 2,3 or the 4,5 to Borough Hall stop. Walk to Atlantic Ave and make a right. Continue one block and after you pass Clinton St and you'll see 141 on the right in the middle of the block.  Not sure if there is a buzzer, so bring your cell phone and Arlenes number.

results.description:
Free. Manhattan. Sunday, August 2nd @ 1 PM

Gotham Yacht Club is looking for fun sailors and non-sailors to join us this weekend!

We take trips around the Manhattan area in a 50-foot Beneteau. We usually sail the Hudson--the Statue of Liberty to the George Washington Bridge--but also go to Martha's Vineyard, the Hamptons and the Jersey Shore.

We like to fill the boat up with about 20-30 people. No sailing experience is required, but preference is given to experienced sailors since the trips can’t happen without them.  As space is limited on the boat, simply RSVP’ing “Yes” to an event does not guarantee a spot on the boat.  If a spot is available, you will be contacted directly with event details.

Sailors can take their first trip to get acquainted and enjoy the party.  From then on, sailors can choose to (1) work the morning shift and help out with the launch or (2) work the evening shift and help out with the return.  Generally, sailors spend less than a third of the trip working and can take the rest of the time to relax and socialize.

The current crew is made up of young, educated Manhattan professionals. We are looking to meet new people who will enjoy the atmosphere and company of everyone on the boat.

If you and/or your friends are interested, please copy, paste, and fill out the questionnaire below in an email and send to [masked]. Please include your current email address so that we can contact you directly.  Since boat trips fill up in advance and we receive many applicants, we may not get back to you immediately.  

We look forward to seeing you on the water!

EVERY APPLICANT (REVELERS, SUNBATHERS, ETC.)

Q) Please provide a link to your page on Facebook or other social networking site. Please attach a picture if you don’t have a page on a social networking site.

Q) How old are you?

Q) Where did you attend school?

Q) Will you please tell us a little bit about yourself?

FOR SAILOR APPLICANTS

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on, but not captained, a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained a sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you crewed on but not captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) How many days, lifetime, have you captained, a non-sailboat?

Q) Will you tell us a little bit about your sailing experience?


Please copy and paste all questions and answers and send in an email to [masked].

Thank you!


FAQ


Q: Do you have to pay to attend a boat party?


A: No, all boat parties are absolutely free.  You may want to bring food and drinks, which are on a potluck basis.


Q: The specific location is not listed.  Where do we meet for the boat party?


A: Unfortunately, we cannot fit everyone who RSVPs to a MeetUp event onto the boat.  There are some crew members and attendees who are not part of the MeetUp group, so there may be less space than it appears.  In order to avoid miscommunication and needing to leave people on the dock, specific details (including meeting location) are sent to members individually.  If you do not receive an invitation via email, you will not be able to attend that week’s boat party.


Q: How often are the boat parties?


A: Boat parties are generally every weekend, either on a Saturday or Sunday.


Q: Do I have to fill out the questionnaire?


A: Yes! Please fill out the questionnaire as thoroughly as possible.  If you are uncomfortable posting any of the information on your profile, please email your responses to [masked].  Without a complete application, you will not be considered to receive an invitation.  The trips last several hours, so we will have 20-30 people in a confined space for an extended period of time. Therefore, we need to have an idea of who we are inviting on the boat and ensure that we have a proper crew.  Please fill out the questionnaire if you are interested in sailing with Gotham Yacht Club.

results.description:
We had the initial intro class that seemed to be a hit. Now it's time to put everything we discussed to use. We are going to meet outdoors (weather permitting) and shoot a low key portrait, a beauty portrait and shoot a couple all using speed lights. 

During the shoots, I will be narrating everything I am doing, but more importantly, why I am doing what I'm doing. Every setting  change I make will be explained to help you all understand the results of each change. We will be shooting in the bright sun, because it would be to easy to shoot under perfect conditions and this will help you all learn how to solve problems in similar situations. 

After the shoots, the couple will be available for you all to practice your flash portraiture. This means you all need to bring your gear. (flashes, triggers, modifiers, diffuser panels, reflectors, etc. As discussed in the first flash workshop, I will not be putting any tripods or light stands down so we don't have any trouble from cops or security guards for not having a permit.


NOTES

1. Please read your user manual and/or bring it with you for reference! 
2. Details of this event can change at anytime. Please check in periodically for updates.



DISCLAIMER: Participation in this event requires that you assume all risks associated with these activities and that the Organizers and Hosts are in no way liable for any loss or injury as a result of your participation. In other words, you are attending these events at your own risk!! For more information, please read the group policy.

results.description:
LOCATION : please note, we will meet in BRYANT PARK, in close proximity of the Carousal, unless there's inclement weather, in which case, we will meet in the lobby area of the Royalton Hotel (opposite the chimney).

READING ASSIGNMENT :  "NOTES from The UNDERGROUND"

Author : Fyodor Dostoyevsky

Arguably one of the greatest novelists in history, Fyodor Dostoevsky is especially notable for interweaving deep philosophical, psychological and theological threads into his brilliant fiction. As a result, his works become much more than stimulating, entertaining stories but actual representation of 19th century intellectual history. This can not be any more true for his most philosophical work of all, Notes from Underground. Notes is Dostoevsky's groundbreaking philosophical prologue to his later novels, and it wrestles with modern existential questions which deal with Man's role in a world where the idea of God was being rejected more and more.
The Enlightenment of the 17th and 18th centuries espoused the value of reason, proclaimed the potential improvement of Man and Society, and freed humanity from superstition. By the 19th century, with the belief in God declining, Dostoevsky saw mankind having lost its moral bearing, wafting directionless in the tempest that is life. Instead of liberating Man for the better, the Enlightenment had renounced his spiritual connection. Where Dostoevsky saw a creature of God, his contemporary philosophers were seeking a new definition of modern man, out from under the definition of God.
Notes provides a greater perspective in European thought. The 19th century was characterized by a brutal polarization of existential thinking in which there was no synthesis. Dostoevsky and Friedrich Nietzsche epitomize this philosophical schism: at one end, Dostoevsky calls for Man to embrace faith and Christian morality; at the other stands Nietzsche, rejecting religion as unnatural and entreating Man to transgress contemporary moral values. By the turn of the century, Man and God were still as much a mystery as before, and so remain.
In Notes, Dostoevsky shows us the Underground Man, a despicable and pitiable creature who betrays himself and is not even aware of it. He is the creation of a thoroughly anti-modern author imploring his fellow Russians to resign from the West.
results.how_to_find_us: I plan to arrive earlier to procure a few tables and chairs for the group. If possible, join me. Here's my cell : 917 613.9736
results.name: Dostoevsky's "Notes from the Underground"

results.description:
Where: Fort Washington Park - Tennis Court #9
 When: 11:00 am - 1:00 pm (1st Hour is Lesson, 2nd Hour is Practice and Play with other students)
Level: Beginners and Advanced Beginners are All Welcome
Max Players: 10 


How to RSVP for the next Tennis Lesson:

1. Create an account at MindBodyOnline scheduling software:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

2. Decide which package you want to purchase:

1 class = $35 Promo code = T15GR1

3 classes = $99 Promo code = T15GR3

6 classes = $179 Promo code = T15GR6

10 classes  = $269 Promo code = T15GR10

3. Go to the Online Store and before Checking Out; APPLY the Promo code of your choice to receive discounted pricing.  

4. Go to the Day and Time of your choice to RSVP your attendance


What's included? 
- Tennis Pro
- Learn something new 
- Meet fun people 
- Get some exercise 
- 1 hour lesson from a Tennis Pro and 1 hour of social hitting
- Racquet available if necessary


Attendance

Unable to attend or need to change the day?  If you change your RSVP on the theMindBodyOnline account with more than 48 hours of notice, you will have that class credited to use in the future with with no problem.  If you try to cancel within 48 hours on yourMindBodyOnline account, you will be charged for the class as a late cancellation or No-Show. I understand things can come up, just be respectful to the class and other students to change your RSVP on the MindBodyOnline account to allow others to join in on that time slot.

WATCH THE VIDEO BELOW AND SEE THE F-U-N !!!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m86vJgPvsxo

ARE YOU READY FOR SOME TENNIS?!?!?


The main reason people don't play tennis in NYC is because: 

It is Too Costly (lessons and permit)

It is Difficult to obtain court space

It is too Hard to find someone to play with

People don't have a Racquet to play with

The good news is you found this site and the #1 resource for anyone interested in tennis in NYC.  At Tennis World, You will be able to:

Find Affordable Lessons

Have an available court

Plenty of People to Meet & Play With (Very Social Fun Group)

There is always extra racquets on hand to use at no cost

It doesn't matter if you have never played or a little rusty, this class is for you because everyone is a little rusty :-)

You'll learn the basics to stop hitting that tennis ball over the fence or chasing it on the other courts. You will learn great tips to start enjoying the game immediately.

Throughout these sessions, you will learn/practice: Ground strokes, serving, volleys, overheads, lobs, footwork and strategies. Each session will focus on different aspects and will provide ample time to practice too! 

In addition to improving your game, you will also get to MEET LOTS OF NEW PEOPLE and have an AWESOME TIME MAKING NEW TENNIS FRIENDS AND HITTING THE BALL. The sessions are both very social and technique oriented.

This event has sold out quickly in the past, so please make sure you RSVP quickly.

What to wear: You'll be running, jumping and moving around.  Make sure to wear sneakers & an outfit that will be appropriate for the weather and exercise. 

What to bring: We recommend water, towel and possibly a snack bar.  If you have a racquet, bring it down, otherwise one can be provided for you at no cost.

Want a Private or Semi-Private Lesson?

A package of Private lessons cost between $55-$65 and Semi-Private lessons (2 people in a class) cost $86.  Create an account at:

https://clients.mindbodyonline.com/classic/home?studioid=152916

Book your appointment online and Call or Text <a>[masked]</a> to confirm.

Weather and Refunds (Rain out?) 

In the event of the class being cancelled due to rain, you will not receive a refund, rather a credit that you will be able to apply for any future class during the week or weekend.  You can also contact: <a>[masked]</a>, to confirm before leaving your apartment to be on the safe side regarding weather and cancellations. 

Remember just because a forecast says 30% chance of showers, that also means 70% chance of no showers. Also with the 30% it may be in your area but not where the courts are.  Lastly, if it does rain, how much rain is estimated, mostly it is passing showers and tennis can resume soon thereafter.

Check out the weather report on the link below:

http://www.accuweather.com/en/us/new-york-ny/10032/hourly-weather-forecast/3727_pc

Questions? 
- Please refrain from using the comment/conversation fields below. 

TEXT: <a>[masked]</a> for a quicker response. 

- Your instructor can be reached at <a>[masked]</a>, if you're running late/lost 
- Yes, bathrooms and fountains are close by the courts

DIRECTIONS: Fort Washington Park Tennis Courts

Via 181 Street Subway Stop

1. Take A Train to 181st Street Station. Sit in the back of the train.

2. Walk West on 181st Street which turns into Plaza Lafayette.

3. Make a Right, Walk 1 minute on Riverside Drive to the Light Green Pedestrian Bridge

4. Make a Left to walk across the bridge.

5. Take the Ramp down from the bridge, Follow the path which will zigzag slightly.

6. Follow the path under the GW Bridge.

7. Just South of the GW Bridge, arrive at Court #9 for your lesson with Tennis World.

Plan an additional 15 minutes for weekend subway schedule times

It will take about 15 minutes to walk from 181st Street Station to Court #9. Plan to arrive about 15 minutes before scheduled class to start on time.

To see all possible directions of the various locations on how to arrive, visit the link below:

http://www.tennisworldnyc.com/where-to-play/

results.description:
Hi Brights, locals and visitors, out of state and international!

Also, to those who are curious about The Brights (the-brights.net) or who we are allied with. You are welcome to explore natural reality with us too!)


As Always: The Museum of Natural History. Every Month. Same Time. Same place. Until further notice.

(Please Note: To further our efforts at remembrance of those like-minded friends who have past away, we are exploring ideas to entrench and revisit their inspirations by creating a fund to set up benches, plaques, fountains and other things in our city. This will be an ongoing discussion until implemented.)


Our monthly Museum Walk and Talk is perpetually on the first Sunday of every month! Same time at 1pm under the lobby dinosaurs (at or near, in the round). At 1:30 we move to the downstairs cafe to nosh and chat. Then we start exploring at 2:30. I usually have a blue New York Atheists hat on and a small brights buttons.

Generally, we try to keep it cheap and educational. The Museum of Natural History's admission is by donation. several of us are members and therefore we take people in as guests as we can. The museum itself is by donation so it is very accessible to everyone. Never avoid coming if you feel you cannot afford it. Just let me know in confidence.


Other events are planned ad-hoc and the city and tri-state  is our oyster...

RSVPs are appreciated but not required unless specifically stated.

Bright Cheers Evolving (BCE),
Charlie [masked], mobile)
Acting Director of The New York Brights

 

"In general people are not born stupid. True stupidity
is achieved only through great effort, such as the Creation Museum in Petersburg, KY"

-Giddian, a Brights Leader, is http://itanjo.com/... and Atheist Axioms at Cafe Press

The mission of God's Love We Deliver is to improve the health and well-being of men, women and children living with HIV/AIDS, cancer and other serious illnesses by alleviating hunger and malnutrition. We prepare and deliver nutritious, high-quality meals to people who, because of their illness, are unable to provide or prepare meals for themselves. For our 4th Players' Lounge World Cup we are opening up the tournament to any teams. Club or international, MLS or La Liga, it's your choice. We except many Real Madrid vs. Real Madrid games for this one.

Event Location:

Nevada Smiths

100 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10003


Tournament Details:

Arrive at 1:30 PM. Event will end by approximately 5:30pm...if you make the finals that is.

World Cup Format - Group stage round robin, followed by the knock out stages.

Games will be played on eight Xbox Ones. 

Refund must be requested three days prior to event.


Tournament Structure:

Group Stage: Round Robin format. Groups will consist of four teams, each player plays everyone in the group once. The top two teams in each group move on to the knock out stage.     Win - 3 Points     Tie - 1 Point      Loss - 0 Points


Group Stage Tie Breakers:      

1. Goal Differential      2. Head to Head      3. Goals Scored      4. Goals Against       


Knock Out Stage: 

Single Elimination Tournament. The #1 seeds in each group will play the #2 seeds from another group.

Games will be played on eight Xbox Ones. If you have a Playstation 4 controller w/ a converter you are welcome to bring it.

Refunds must be requested three days prior to event.


Prizes:

1st Place - $100

2nd Place - $60

3rd Place - $20


Rules:

6 Minute Halves.


Legendary Difficulty.

Injuries Off.

Knock Out Stages: Overtime is played in classic. PKs at the end of extra time will not count. Games that are tied after 120 minutes will be restarted and played under a golden goal stipulation.
