results.description:
You are invited to our specialized Stress Reduction workshop, which is for moms both PRE and POST natal!

It will cover:

-How stress affects you (physiologically and mentally!)
-How stress affects your baby (before and after birth!)
-How to deal with it properly (what works best for you!) 

We are New Yorkers. Stress is our life. 

But that doesn't mean we can't take at least some control of the kinds of stressors in our lives and more importantly how we react to them. This workshop is invaluable. We could ALL use some more knowledge and personal tactics to tackle such issues, especially given that they affect everyone around us INCLUDING our babies.

*Some healthy snacks, drinks and related materials will be provided. Please let us know if you have any suggestions!
Also, it is best to bring a pen, paper and an open mind =)

Please RSVP here and feel free to introduce yourself in the comments section!
Contact Eva for any further questions.

(If cannot make the time listed but you would like to attend this workshop, please comment or send Eva a message and perhaps we can accommodate).

*All events are sponsored by Bria Body. Please visit BriaBody.com to learn more.

results.description:
This workshop will introduce you to Arduino-based physical computing. Learn how to accept inputs from pushbuttons, sensors and potentiometers, and control LEDs and other actuators, and interact with the physical world through code. 

The workshop will be based on Teensy LC, a lower cost Arduino clone. Teensy LC is cheap and small enough that you will be more likely to leave it soldered into projects, which we encourage. It also has high quality USB drivers, so you can use it to emulate a USB keyboard or other devices.

Requirements:

• Some technical knowledge: either basic electronics knowledge (corresponding to about a third of this study program), basic experience with programming, or something else

• A laptop running Windows, OS X or Linux that you have experience using

Parts kit

The fee includes a parts kit containing:

• Teensy LC and USB cable

• Solderless breadboard and jumper wires

• Pushbutton, potentiometer, a few resistors, LEDs 

• Other components that will be determined later and used if there is time at the end of the class

Other random notes

• There is no discount if you already have some of the parts. 

• There is a $15 discount for Hack Manhattan members that you will receive as a refund if you attend. 

• You may bring one guest who will not receive the parts kit. However, there is limited space around the tables, so make clear to your guest that he or she must sit on a chair behind you.
results.how_to_find_us: Hack Manhattan is on the second floor, in the back of the building
results.name: Basic Arduino Workshop with Teensy LC

results.description:
Así empieza lo malo cuenta la historia íntima de un matrimonio de muchos años, narrada por su joven testigo cuando éste es ya un hombre plenamente adulto. Juan de Vere encuentra su primer empleo como secretario personal de Eduardo Muriel, un antaño exitoso director de cine, en el Madrid de 1980. Su trabajo le permite entrar en la privacidad de la casa familiar y ser espectador de la misteriosa desdicha conyugal entre Muriel y su esposa Beatriz Noguera.

Muriel le encarga que investigue y sonsaque a un amigo suyo de media vida, el Doctor Jorge Van Vechten, de cuyo indecente comportamiento en el pasado le han llegado rumores. Pero Juan no se limitará a eso y tomará dudosas iniciativas, porque, como él mismo reconoce desde su edad madura, #los jóvenes tienen el alma y la conciencia aplazadas#. Así descubrirá que no hay justicia desinteresada, sino que está siempre contaminada por el rencor personal y por los propios deseos, y que todo perdón o castigo son arbitrarios.

results.description:
Experience the Overflowing Power of Gratitude!


Special Vedic Meditation Event in Washington Sq. Park, Sunday August 2nd

Join us for a very special Gratitude Meditation Event in Washington Square Park!


The universe is constantly showering us with gifts and auspiciousness, but we often don't see it or take advantage of it because we are not living life in the right context!  

What would happen if we shifted ourselves from the attitude of asking the universe for what we want next, to the attitude of feeling and expressing causeless gratitude?

When we open up our being to the joys and power of gratitude, we are ready to receive the gifts from the universe and our life becomes an expression of joy and wonder!

Benefits of Gratitute (Crown Chakra) Meditation:

• Moves us from discontentment to contentment in life

• Opens us up to receiving the gifts and harnessing all the possibilities from the universe

• Empowers us to live a blissful existence

• Being in the highest frequency of gratitude automatically allows our desires and realities to manifest 

Join us this Sunday in Washington Square Park for this very powerful meditation from living enlightened Master, Paramahamsa Nithyananda!

When: Sunday, August 2nd, 2015

Start Time: Meet at 2:00 pm sharp

Please meet us on time!

Meeting Place: In front of the arch at Washington Square Park in NYC.  We will then be walking to the west side of the park to find a spot.  

Call if you can't find us:  (917)[masked]

Park Location:  Washington Square Park

5th Ave & Washington Square North

Greenwich Village, NY

(Located near following subway stops:

Astor Place stop, 8th St. stop or West 4th St. stop) 

Cost: This is a free meditation event, donations are optional.

IMPORTANT NOTE: We'll be sitting on the grass so please bring a small blanket or yoga mat to sit on.

Contact us with any questions at: (917)[masked]

Please feel free to invite to your family & friends.  All are welcome!

results.description:
Experience the Overflowing Power of Gratitude!


Special Meditation Event in Washington Sq. Park, Sunday August 2nd

Join us for a very special Gratitude Meditation Event in Washington Square Park!


The universe is constantly showering us with gifts and auspiciousness, but we often don't see it or take advantage of it because we are not living life in the right context!  

What would happen if we shifted ourselves from the attitude of asking the universe for what we want next, to the attitude of feeling and expressing causeless gratitude?

When we open up our being to the joys and power of gratitude, we are ready to receive the gifts from the universe and our life becomes an expression of joy and wonder!

Benefits of Gratitute (Crown Chakra) Meditation:

• Moves us from discontentment to contentment in life

• Opens us up to receiving the gifts and harnessing all the possibilities from the universe

• Empowers us to live a blissful existence

• Being in the highest frequency of gratitude automatically allows our desires and realities to manifest 

Join us this Sunday in Washington Square Park for this very powerful meditation from living enlightened Master, Paramahamsa Nithyananda!


When:

Sunday, August 2nd, 2015

Meet at 2:00 pm sharp

Please meet us on time!

results.description:
Disclosure Network New York Meeting Announcement

Date: Sunday, August 2, 2015

Location: CAP 21 Studios, 18 West 18th St., (Between 5th Ave. & 6th Ave., South Side of Street), Room 608, 6th Floor, NYC

Time: 2pm-4pm
(Please arrive 10 minutes in the lobby before 2pm meeting begins in the assigned room! Try to be on time as late arrivals should be avoided if at all possible.)

Speaker: MARK KIMMEL

Topic(s): “ANGELS, ETs & Us: Who we really are & why we are here.”

Program (live event): Mark will speak about the history of Earth from its inception and why it is unique in this galaxy. He will also address who we really are as both physical and non-physical beings, and why we are here. Much of this information is new to this planet. Mark will be speaking via Skype to a PowerPoint presentation produced for this occasion. Questions are encouraged.

Bio: Mark Kimmel has spoken at international forums, been a guest on radio and television shows, and has conducted workshops based on his unique insights into the transformation of Earth and her humans. Mark's books first three books, “Trillion,” “Decimal,” & “One,” depict the activities benevolent ETs among us along with negative aspects of our 3rd Dimension paradigm. “Transformation,” contain messages from Andromedans and celestials. His new book, “Chrysalis,” is being written in conjunction with the Archangels and is contains information new to this planet. By focusing on both extraterrestrials and Archangels in his writing and speaking, Mark weaves a most credible picture of cosmic reality while presenting an uplifting vision for the future of mankind and of our planet. Mark avoids the “evil aliens” orientation of many who deal with ETs, while presenting insights about Archangels without a religious orientation. Mark moved to his current passion from a successful business career where he had worked for major corporations, then founded and ran three of the most respected Colorado venture capital funds. In addition to providing capital, Mark served on portfolio companies’ boards and helped them with strategy and tactics. He retired from business in 1996 to pursue his quest into the larger aspects of our existence. Mark has been listed in Who’s Who since 1985. He has degrees in engineering, marketing, finance, psychology, and divinity. Mark is married with two grown sons and four grandchildren. He spends his days writing and speaking about this, the pivotal juncture in human history, and how each person has the power to assist this metamorphic transformation for all on this planet and in this universe. He is the founder of the Cosmic Paradigm Network, an international group dedicated to manifesting such a transformation. Contact Mark Kimmel: Email: <a>CP@...</a> Web Site:http://www.cosmicparadigm.com/

Look for Mark's new book, “Chrysalis”at www.cosmicparadigm.comorwww.Amazon.com

Please plan to attend what is bound to be one of the most interesting DNNY meetings to date and invite your interested friends to join us!

For questions/comments please contact: Nick Curto, DNNY Director/Co-Founder
E-mail: <a>nicknyny1@...</a> Phone[masked]

Meeting Details: Admission $10 per person. Children admitted Free. Our treasure will collect your admission fee in the meeting room before the program begins.
R.S.V.P. Strongly recommended for people attending the meeting for the first time.

3 Important Notes:

1. No food or beverages are allowed in any rooms of the venue except bottled water that may be brought into the venue. You can also purchase chilled bottled water at the Welcome Desk in the Lobby for $1.
2. Please silence your cell phones when entering the meeting room.
3. No photos may be taken or sound recording is ever allowed at any of the DNNY meetings.

results.description:
(This in a one time only Sunday meeting. It replaces the Saturday, Aug. 1 meeting)

-----

Writing exercises bend and free the mind in the same way a yoga session can stretch and free the body. Don't worry--I'm not suggesting we write while in yoga poses (it's an interesting thought...). But this session will be filled with challenging exercises of the written kind.

Bring something to write on. Try a different medium if you can, paper instead of tablet or vice versa.

Bring a book (e or regular) that you think has the greatest ending. It takes a fabulous beginning to get most people to continue reading. 

But an ending can break your heart, make you cry, piss you off or demand a sequel. We'll do two writing prompts, one about endings, and one starting with "I Don't Remember," both with a different twist. We'll spend the last hour reading and discussing work anyone brings in. 

------

At our last session, our discussion on journals and the writing prompt "my greatest dissapointment" ignited some deep discussions about family, disappointment, parents and personal goals. We also heard some great new work--a novel, short story and poem--as well as Barbara's continuing adventures through the eyes of her Teddy bear. The talent that joins our writing group always impresses me.

Last session we also bid farewell to a good friend and blossoming novelist, Ashley, who is DC-bound. She's been our location host--and host in general! This is the 2nd time she baked for us! She has family here, so she promised to be back for visits. Good luck Ashley! We're going to miss you!

------

If you've RSVP'd 'Yes' but can't make it, please change it to 'No.' This MeetUp typically has a waiting list, so please free up the spot for someone else. Thanks!

-----

We're looking for a location host to avoid meeting in public spaces. Any ideas? A store with space in the back would work, an office that's open on Saturday, an apartment building or hotel with a great lobby.... I'm willing to talk to management and let them know all the great benefits of hosting the NYC Writing Club, all the accolades, sponsorship opportunities. Any thoughts, email me at [masked]

Happy writing,

cindy

results.description:
Open Painting Meet-Up focuses on having a setting conducive to exploring your creative side through painting. We primarily meet in group organizer/artist Thomas Legaspi's Art Studio/School where artists can come and paint bathed in North Light from a wall of windows.  Painters can paint from still-life set-up, photographs, their digital tablets, or imagination. There are easels, slop sinks, painting racks, clean-up supplies, solvents, and soaps, provided. A $25 fee is charged for the 2.5 hour meet-up. Artists should supply their own materials such as paints, brushes, and canvases, etc. Instruction and supplies are available for additional costs. $35 with instruction and your own materials, $45 with materials to be supplied as well as instruction.

Planned Meet-ups include outdoor plein air paintings, trips to the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Bronx Botanical Gardens, painting from the live model in outdoor settings.

The Group meets up currently on Saturdays from 1:30 PM to 4:00 PM (winter schedule) Should this time slot fill up, we will run a Sunday session from 2:00 PM to 4:30 PM. Most Meet-up events have light refreshments and background music.

Please view the organizer's website for images of his work and more information- www.thomaslegaspi-art.com.

Thanks and Happy Painting!
results.name: Sunday Afternoon Open Paint!

results.description:
Lets' do it again and enjoy these beautiful pools while we can.  Only 5 more weeks to go! The HEAT IS ON so come take a break from the  "hot trails" and cool off with a refreshing swim at another local  gem in Park Ridge, NJ with Room to swim! (adult swims called if needed)


MEET JAY GLASER and (me)Susan BY THE ENTRANCE AS WE ARE HIS GUESTS OR GIVE HIS NAME WHEN YOU COME IN and look for the MEETUP SIGN INSIDE.  (will try to set up to the right of the diving boards if possible)

There are grassy areas and some free chairs available (first come basis) so you may want to bring your own lounge chairs, umbrellas and blankets. Food & Refreshments with healthy choices are also available to purchase.

Bring  something to share,  cards, etc and don't forget the sun protection and bugspray!


Stay for an hour or two or  stay til closing at 8 if you choose!  Admission is only $5.50 weekdays and $7.00 weekends for seniors, $10 for adults weekdays and $14 weekends the whole day and you do not have to be a resident!  Senior residents are FREE. 

We only have til Labor Day, to enjoy these pools, so let's take advantage while the sun is shining!! Hope to see yah there. Let's "air out" those " tired dogs”!   

Directions From Rockland County: Take Rt 45(Chestnut Ridge Rd) toward Jersey to  Grand Ave.. 

Turn left onto Grand Ave..  

Turn right on Spring Valley Rd. at light. 

In a short distance turn left on Colony Ave.

Pass Peppercorns restaurant immediately on your left and pool parking lot will come up shortly on your right.  LOOK FOR THE PARK RIDGE POOL SIGN ON THE ROCK.   Park and walk across the blue bridge to the entrance.

FOR additional DIRECTIONS GO TO: http://swim.isport.com/swimming-pools/us/new-jersey/park-ridge/park-ridge-municipal-pool-1018734   Enter your address and click on directions box. 

Inclement weather cancels.  Always check the day of an event for any changes.  See photos below for landmarks.  

Note diving boards and area to the right above (if not available look for meetup sign)

results.description:
This is an ENCORE. Participants at the July 12th meet-up unanimously expressed a desire to meet again. New comers are welcomed.

No reading required. We will broaden our discussion to include all forms of EXISTENTIALISM.


"Modern life seems to condemn us to live in an awe-depleted, efficiency driven world, where reductionism runs rampant and big questions about life are all but eradicated".     (a quote from, The New Existentialists)

_____________________________________________

ASSIGNMENT : perform your own homework/preparation for the discussion.

Here are some suggestions to ignite your engagement :

1. Watch this : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HH-9XkjqYHY

2. Explore and read this website : https://www.saybrook.edu/newexistentialists/about

3. Existentialism in the USA, by Walter Kaufman http://www.walterkaufmann.com/articles/1969_Reception_Existentialism_Salmagundi.pdf

4. Existential Psychotherapy , by Rollo May

5. The Courage to Be, by Paul Tillich

6. The Stranger,  by Albert Camus

7. Philosophy of Existentialism,  by Gabriel Marcel

_______________________________________________

Existential psychology is a perspective that places emphasis on the human condition as a whole. It uses a positive approach that applauds human capacities and aspirations while simultaneously acknowledging human limitations. Existential psychology shares many similarities with humanistic psychology, experiential psychotherapy, depth psychotherapy, and relational psychotherapy.

American Existential psychology developed out of the philosophies and writings of Friedrich Nietzsche, Soren Kierkegaard, William James, Abraham Maslow, Rollo May and others. 

As one of the first existential philosophers, Kierkegaard theorized that human discontent could only be overcome through internal wisdom. Later, Nietzsche further developed the theory of existentialism by introducing the idea of free will and personal responsibility. In the early 1900s, philosophers such as Martin Heidegger and Jean-Paul Sartre began to explore the role of investigation and interpretation in the healing process. Over the next several decades, other contemporaries started to acknowledge the importance of experiencing in relation to understanding as a method to achieving psychological wellness and balance.
results.how_to_find_us: I will arrive early and attempt to procure tables, just east of the Carousel. I will have the book and possibly a sign. My cell is 917 613.9736
results.name: ENCORE : a discussion on Existentialsim

7. Philosophy of Existentialism,  by Gabriel Marcel

_______________________________________________

Existentialism is a perspective that places emphasis on the human condition as a whole. It uses a positive approach that applauds human capacities and aspirations while simultaneously acknowledging human limitations. Existential psychology shares many similarities with humanistic psychology, experiential psychotherapy, depth psychotherapy, and relational psychotherapy.

American Existential psychology developed out of the writings and philosophies of Friedrich Nietzsche, Soren Kierkegaard, Jean-Paul Sartre, William James, Abraham Maslow, Rollo May and others.

As one of the first existential philosophers, Kierkegaard theorized that human discontent could only be overcome through internal wisdom. Later, Nietzsche further developed the theory of existentialism by introducing the idea of free will and personal responsibility. In the early 1900s, philosophers such as Martin Heidegger and Jean-Paul Sartre began to explore the role of investigation and interpretation in the healing process. Over the next several decades, other contemporaries started to acknowledge the importance of experiencing in relation to understanding as a method to achieving psychological wellness and balance.

The Inner Engineering online program includes guided meditations, powerful breathing techniques, and deeply engaging discourses about the nature of the mind and practical wisdom to manage life’s situations.

Inner Engineering is a combination of methods derived from the ancient science of yoga that addresses every aspect of human well-being — from your body, mind and emotions to the fundamental of life energy within. 

This 1 hour introduction to Inner Engineering explains the fundamental approach of the program in a live setting that offers you the opportunity to ask a trained Isha teacher questions about the program and practices available.

“Inner Engineering is neither a religion, nor a philosophy or dogma; It is a technology for wellbeing. One does not have to believe or disbelieve, you just have to learn to use it. Technology will produce results irrespective of who you are.” – Sadhguru

results.description:
Three distinct neighborhoods in Manhattan with unique beats yet connected in proximity and creativity. Come explore SoHo’s architectural treasures and learn of it’s art, shopping, culture and more. We will also experience how Italians have shaped  the most iconic Italian enclave in the U.S. We then later finish exploring sections on the largest Chinatown in North America.

Itinerary: 
• SoHo’s Cast-Iron District 
• Richard Haas Mural on Spring St. 
• Haughwout Building 
• The Italian American Museum 
• Church of the Most Precious Blood 
• Mahayana Buddhist Temple 
• Columbus Park 
• And More

Experience a cultural patrimony that will connect you to sections of New York and also the world.


Reservations: 
Required. You must RSVP. Please, if you RSVP and later realize you will not be able to attend change your reservation ASAP.


Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins in front of the Apple Store in SoHo on 103 Prince St. map here (Prince St. side). Tour concludes at Columbus Park map here.


Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.


Some of the Sights we will experience:


I look forward to meeting you and showing you a great time in a great section of New York!

results.description:
Deadline for submission of stories to be critiqued is Monday of the week preceeding the Meetup. On Tuesday, an email will be sent, listing the stories to be critiqued and in what order. Print out and mark up your copies in advance or read and mark up electronic comments.

Stories can be any length up to approx. 7,000 words. Flash fiction welcome.

You can submit your story to me (Marcy) directly, or submit to Dropbox per the Procedures (see below). My email is [masked].

Please make sure your manuscript is properly formatted. Read through our Short Story Group Procedures for guidelines and an example, as well as advice for a constructive critique. Having manuscripts already formatted makes the critiquing process easier.

Most of the meeting will be spent critiquing work of group members. There is a structure to make sure critiques are as helpful as possible for everyone involved, so writers leave with a clear idea of what to do next with their stories.

We also spend time talking about writing, sharing news and information, and getting to know one another. It's always easier to take constructive criticism from someone you know!

Flash pieces: If there is time (and there usually is), we can critique one or two last minute flash pieces that weren't submitted. Best method is to print out a copy for each participant. We will read the story there and give on-the-spot critiques.
results.name: Marcy's Short Story Meetup

results.description:
WARNING: There are no easy exits to drop out. Once we have gone a few miles, we are in the wilderness, and your only choices are to find your way back out the way we came (good luck -- you'll probably get lost) or continue on forward to the end.  Also, you MUST keep up with the group! If you straggle behind and get lost, it will be very hard to navigate and you could easily wind up walking 15 miles before you find a subway.  If you think you'll find a cab, be serious -- this is the boroughs.

The hike will end at a restaurant, which we should reach around 6:30pm.

Bear in mind that if I want to meet you, I'm stuck at the front so I'm powerless to talk with you unless you come up front with me.  So by all means, come up and join in the conversation.

We'll start at the Northmost stop on the "4" train ("Woodlawn Station"), at the bottom of the East stairwell.

We will be going 7 miles between bathroom breaks.

If you arrive by car, make plans for how you're going to get from the end back to the finish.  Hopstop recommends taking the BX9 bus from 242nd St & Broadway toward "West Farms", getting off at Jerome Ave, then taking the 4 subway North three stations back to Woodlawn.

WEAR LONG PANTS!!! One of the first trails we'll take in Van Cortlandt is totally overgrown with weeds, some of which are stinging plants. You really won't want to walk through there without your legs covered.

Attendance at this event is free, and all participants attend at their own risk. Everyone will be required to sign a release waiver that basically gives up any right whatsoever to sue, to the fullest extent possible by law. You can read the current draft of this waiver at http://bluejacket7.com/legal/WalkingWaiver.doc
results.how_to_find_us: At the bottom of the east stairwell at the last subway stop of the "4" train.
results.name: Brainy 7 Mile Van Cortlandt Park Hike

results.description:
This is an ENCORE. Participants at the July 12th meet-up unanimously expressed a desire to meet again. New comers are welcomed.

No reading required. We will broaden our discussion to include all forms of EXISTENTIALISM.


"Modern life seems to condemn us to live in an awe-depleted, efficiency driven world, where reductionism runs rampant and big questions about life are all but eradicated".   (a quote from, The New Existentialists)

_____________________________________________

ASSIGNMENT : perform your own homework/preparation for the discussion.

Here are some suggestions to ignite your engagement :

1. Watch this : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HH-9XkjqYHY

2. Explore and read this website : https://www.saybrook.edu/newexistentialists/about

3. Existentialism in the USA, by Walter Kaufman http://www.walterkaufmann.com/articles/1969_Reception_Existentialism_Salmagundi.pdf

4. Existential Psychotherapy , by Rollo May

5. The Courage to Be, by Paul Tillich

6. The Stranger, Albert Camus

_______________________________________________

Existential psychology is a perspective that places emphasis on the human condition as a whole. It uses a positive approach that applauds human capacities and aspirations while simultaneously acknowledging human limitations. Existential psychology shares many similarities with humanistic psychology, experiential psychotherapy, depth psychotherapy, and relational psychotherapy.

American Existential psychology developed out of the philosophies and writings of Friedrich Nietzsche, Soren Kierkegaard, William James, Abraham Maslow, Rollo May and others. 

As one of the first existential philosophers, Kierkegaard theorized that human discontent could only be overcome through internal wisdom. Later, Nietzsche further developed the theory of existentialism by introducing the idea of free will and personal responsibility. In the early 1900s, philosophers such as Martin Heidegger and Jean-Paul Sartre began to explore the role of investigation and interpretation in the healing process. Over the next several decades, other contemporaries started to acknowledge the importance of experiencing in relation to understanding as a method to achieving psychological wellness and balance.

results.description:
THIS MONTH'S THEME: Stories about "WHAT YOU DESERVE"

We have all witnessed countless stories through the course of our lives. Some come from family or friends; others come from the news, movies, school, or other cultural institutions. Whether or not we intend them to, the stories we've encountered can shape our belief systems, feelings, and behaviors. This meetup is intended to create a space for critical examination of some 'American' stories- referring to the stories that most individuals living in the United States have been influenced by in one way or another. At earlier points in history, it would be more difficult to find such commonly encountered stories; however, with current levels of uniformity among the most prominent cultural institutions in the U.S. (media, K-12 education, entertainment, etc.), and widespread convenient access to such sources, we have a unique opportunity to spotlight some widespread, common influences.

A theme will be chosen in advance for each of the meetings. Themes will highlight particular aspects of our daily existence by addressing various circumstances/experiences (success, embarrassment, wealth, imprisonment, enlightenment, boredom, etc.), personal characteristics (kind/ruthless, honest/deceitful, ambitious/lazy, respectable/pitiful, etc.), and roles (friend/foe, parent/child, boss/employee, partner/spouse, teacher/student, woman/man, etc.), encountered in our lives.

PLEASE BRING A "STORY":

I ask that attendees bring a "story" related to the theme of that particular month's meeting. This "story" can consist of an image, a phrase or saying, a recurrent movie plot or advertising angle, some common advice or explanation... anything that you think might be commonly encountered in U.S. culture. At the beginning of each meeting, the stories brought by participants will be introduced (approx 1 minute each), and we will vote to determine which story (or stories) to investigate during that particular meeting. The following questions will guide our investigation thereafter:

1) What are the obvious and less-obvious messages/morals being communicated through the common story?

2) What feelings and actions might we expect from a person who has internalized the messages/morals being communicated through the common story?

3) What realities (from our personal experiences) would contradict the messages/morals being communicated through the common story?

4) What feelings and actions might we expect from a person who has internalized the messages/morals of the contradicting realities?                           

5) What are some implications for society as a whole?

I look forward to an invigorating and liberating exchange. ;)
results.name: 'AMERICAN'­ STORIES: Uncovering Myths and Discovering Realities

Meet on the american football field (near the entrance close to the public restrooms)!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 3:30. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 3:30. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

results.description:
Multi-language picnic! PLEASE ARRIVE EARLY, READ all of description below so you're informed!

We will meet BY THE BENCH at park entrance with FLAGS or a MEETUP SIGN from 3:50-4:10 PM.

If you would like to attend, you must bring either:

a) FOOD (would be great if relevant to your language but not necessary)!
b) DRINK with plenty of disposable cups (2 large bottles at least)!
c) SUPPLIES, paper plates, napkins, forks (& knives, spoons) trash bags!

If you do not bring food you must contribute $5. It is $1 to attend. This is a picnic! the idea is to share! Bring food, so you don't have to pay the $5!


You can either make or buy something but whatever you bring should be able to be shared with your language group. GUYS especially, you should spend at least $5 on something, it's totally not enough to just bring a bottle of water or a roll of napkins, if you don't know what to bring follow the "abc" choice list above! Please be considerate to other members.

There may be no chairs, only sometimes available, so we will be sitting on the grass. Bring a sheet to sit on & proper attire, forecast says 75! We will split off into small groups by language and spread out into conversational language practice groups of Spanish, English, French, Portuguese, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Chinese, Hebrew, German, Arabic & Russian.

You will have option to meet us at a specific corner between 3:50 and 4:10 (20 minutes). If you're not familiar with Central Park, please be on time, and meet us at corner, otherwise it will be difficult to find us!

Let any of the organizers know as soon as you arrive if you are interested in this lesson and please be on time, we only have a few spots, first come first served!

IMPORTANT
1. Please CHECK-IN with us once inside the park for a name tag!

2. We are asking all members to spend at least 1/4 of their time HELPING out in their native language! That way we all help each other, you meet people interested in your culture and you make more friends!

3. Please CLEAN UP after yourselves! (coffee cups, papers, etc) Members who don't will be removed from our group!

4. Fee will be charged $1 for the event

5. If you bring nothing you must pay $5 to attend.

6. If you can't come to the event please update your RSVP status before it closes, so other members have the opportunity to come. (members that RSVP yes and don't show 3 times will be removed from the group)

7. If you come to this event is because you agree to our rules above. We REMOVE members that break our rules, are rude, aggressive or socially inappropriate towards our members.
results.name: Language Exchange Sunday Picnic!

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

Room assignment will be printed on the electronic billboard opposite the elevators on floor 16.

People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great latte and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

I've been asked to post this:


Dear Members:  This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
We’re going to meet up this Sunday for a free group lesson in Central Park! From 4-5pm we’ll start with some common questions:
barre chords, strumming patterns... feel free to bring any individual questions, because most likely, someone’s been wondering the same thing!

If you’d like to stay from 5-6pm, we’re going to write a song in an hour using just chords and techniques you know. I’ll also be free to help if you get stuck. You’re welcome to stay and share your song with the group, or hang around and listen! We usually go for dinner afterwards in the area.

To bring list:

-guitar
-paper + pencil
-water + sunblock
-snacks for the group are always welcome!
-your adorable smile
results.name: FREE 2 hour group lesson and songwriting session

results.description:
RC47-Version Fun & Games MeetUp!...


Welcome back Fun Gamers!

First, thank you all for joining our MeetUp Group, "Fun & Games!"... 

Please help us grow!...  please share our group on Google+ & Facebook!

There are "high-res" photos available if you want to print a flyer for work and/or school!

Donations...  :-)  I've been asked a couple of times about this; so here are the details...  with respect to expenses, the largest expense currently is the MeetUp membership.  It costs $14.99 per month or $179.88 per year to host a MeetUp Group like Fun & Games.

Ideally I'd like to have some money to be able to replace a damaged game (though it luckily has not as of yet) and buy new games for the group and setup a real website for the group and/or help us it for group trips (I'd love to do a Murder Mystery Get-A-Way this Halloween in 2015.)

There are three ways you can make a donation:

• Cash in the Donation Box - (preferred) - you may be asking "what" donation box...  you're right, we've not had one; but after 25 MeetUps I suppose it's time we have one (it's also less awkward than people handing me money ;-)


• Donate via PayPal - (preferred) - Just click, "Pay or Send Money", then "Send money to friends and family", then enter tredekka||at||yahoo.com  (where ||at|| == @)

• Donate via MeetUp - (least preferred) - use the [ChipIn] link to the left to donate...  this is least preferred because MeetUp/WePay takes ~10-20%, which is 3-6 times the industry average.


• NOTE - regardless of which method you choose, please let me know via a private message here on MeetUp... I won't get a notification otherwise. :-(


Finally, I get asked "how much" should I donate.  My goal on this group isn't to make money, and I understand some of our members are very tight on money.  So I've "payed it forward" to get the group started, and now it'd be great if at least the membership dues are helped covered.  If you take our average attendance for the past six months, and do some estimations it works out to about 2-3 bucks per person per month.  So if you'd like to give once a year, pitch in about $24-$36.  If you want to toss in a buck a week, sounds great.  If you can't, no worries at all; if you want to pitch in more, "you're a good man, Charlie Brown."  :-D

(-:  New Social Games Initiative & "Monthly" Game Spotlight!  ;-)


Yes, yes, yes...  always changing, always trying to improve...  for the next few month's we're going to try changing our "Weekly" Game Spotlight, to a "Monthly" Game Spotlight...  July's GotM > MtG

New Updates -

Game Tracking will start this week with MtG & our Social Game -- earn F&G points towards our awards night!  You get F&G points just for playing the games & you get bonus F&G points for being based on how you play in MtG and whether or not you're on the winning team for the social game!

Next week -- we'll not only have game tracking, but event & new ppl tracking...  earn F&G points, just for showing up & playing one game...  also, earn F&G points for bringing someone new.  :-)

Finally, here's "mostly" the details for the 1 Year Anniversary -- please RSVP to that event separately...  

• There will be an unofficial post-picnic gaming MeetUp at Panera for those interested...  please RSVP to both, if you plan to go to both.

Congratulations Everyone for making Fun & Games a success!!!


I think our new New Social Games Initiative & Monthly Game Spotlight is continuing to be a success on both regards...  This week, it'll be at the picnic.


Please feel free to PM me about this and/or anything else regarding Fun & Games MeetUp!

See you at 4PM on Sunday!

There will be more 2015 changes/details to come, but I wanted to let you know there's a lot more to come in 2015!!!


Do you want a teaser?...

• We'll start our player / game tracking in 2015!  ...  and at our 2015 Holiday Party, we'll give out awards for various categories!  (It's only about 336 days away, but I wanted to give you time to prepare...  :-P)


Thanks & hope to see you there!

George

a.k.a. Jorge Loco

PS RSVP isn't required, but it'll definitely help me out!

PPS Shall we play a game?

http://www.meetup.com/Fun-And-Games-Meetup-Tenafly-Northern-New-Jersey-NJ/messages/boards/thread/48695815/

results.description:
Queen Salons are monthly gatherings designed for graduates of the 3-day Queen’s Code for Life workshop (formerly Celebrating Women: Regarding Ecstasy and Power™ workshop and commonly referred to as the “Queen Course”). If you have recently taken the Queen's Code for Life workshop and want to participate in the Queen Salons, please email <a>[masked]</a>. 

A Queen Salon is a safe and sacred space where you can connect with sister Queens, share your wisdom and energy, nurture and expand your Queen, and help each other embody your best and truest selves. We hope you will be excited to participate, create, laugh, and fill your tanks with your sister Queens in this loving Queen community.

In a Queen Salon, we will: 

• discuss and explore PAX material

• share personal triumphs and challenges

• strengthen our abilities to honor ourselves, our men, and our realms 

Join us for a casual evening of tank filling fun. 

This month's topic - Feminine Leadership

The QUEEN as the SPACE for Creating Change in Her Realm” As Queens, we're leaders in our communities.  What does that mean for us individually and collectively, and how do we create the space for positive change? How do we inspire and empower the people in 

our Realm to support our vision and to step into their own greatness? What has been your experience in leading from the Feminine? Let’s share our challenges and celebrate our triumphs.
results.name: Queen Salon - Topic: Feminine Leadership

results.description:
Join DM Noah Anderson for this second chapter of Wildpig Exclusive "Sailing Against the Wind" for PCs of level 4! This free character building session is so that you can ask Noah questions, become acquainted with the environment, and meet your fellow players. New players are welcome and encouraged! Returning players, bring your character from last chapter to this character building session to level up.

The battle ended poorly. Terrible beasts and deadly magic set both Pirate and Navy adrift. Now, with only wreckage between them and open ocean around them, two foes must become one crew. Perhaps then, they may survive. Will you find salvation... or ultimate sacrifice?
results.name: D&D 5E: SATW - The Flotsam Alliance - Character Building Session

results.description: Join journalist Priya S to learn the only meditation in the world that will stop your unnecessary, unwanted thoughts of the past and the future and give you the silence of the present moment.  Super easy, will take only 10-15 minutes.  Free of cost.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 35-45 - 2f/3m spots left

results.description:
5:00-5:15: Requisite fifteen minute schmoozing.
5:15-6:15: We write for an hour, a la the "Shut Up & Write" meetups.
6:15-6:25: Replenish mind and body after intense and gratifying writing session via the ordering of food and drink.
6:25-8:00: We critique, in a a supportive way, two pieces from group members. The two pieces will have been designated the previous week. These files are available through the "Files" section on this site.
8:00: Sad farewells, until next week.

We look forward to seeing you at the Sunday AWG Meetup. Any questions, please feel free to contact us through this site.

PLEASE NOTE: You must attend at least one meetup before submitting a piece for review.

PLEASE NOTE AGAIN: It's probably a good idea to bring headphones and a music player, as it's unpredictable what sort of background noise is going to be going on during the writing session.

All files to be critiqued on Sunday are available from the "Files" section, which is under the "More" Menu at the top of the page. The direct link to the "Files" page is:

http://www.meetup.com/astoriawritersgroup/files/
results.how_to_find_us: The cool looking people with laptops, tablets, paper, stone & chisel . . .
results.name: Astoria Writers Write(!)

results.description:
Everybody loves Playstation, right? Hey, wait, come back!!

Jokes aside, there'll be a smorgasbord of Playstation games and systems for you to play around with at this meetup! Taking center stage will be the new kid on the block, the Playstation 4, and his parents the happy Playstation 3 and backwards compatible Playstation 3(so PS2 and PS1) watching from the side! Be sure to come down and join us!
results.name: NYC Gamer's Night: Playstation Night - Four Score and Three Generations Ago...

results.description:
At Lammas, sometimes called Lughnasadh, it's time to celebrate the first harvest of the year, and recognize that the hot summer days will soon come to an end.   The plants of spring wither and drop seeds to ensure future crops. Grains are ready to be harvested and the fruits are ripe for picking.  We can give thanks for the food on our tables.

Hekate's Sacred Temple's NYC Chapter invites the Pagan Community as we come together to celebrate the first harvest of the season. Come and join us at this festive rite and we ask for a $10 donation to help with expense*PLEASE NOTE THE CHANGE OF THE LOCATION:

RIPLEY GRIER STUDIOS                        520 8th Avenue                         Studio 17A

PLEASE TRY AND BE THERE BETWEEN 5 PM AND 5:15 THE RITUAL WILL PROMPTLY START AT 5:30 IF YOU ARE LATE PLEASE HAVE SOMEONE CUT YOU INTO THE CIRCLE*The location has changed due to the extreme heat and chance of a thunderstorm. After the ritual you are welcome to join us for a meal at a local Chinese restaurant
results.name: Lughnasadh

group.name: The New York City Witches Meetup Group

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Walk-and-Eat in a West Greenwich Village Tour made popular for its authentic bohemian history. You will find famous places where celebrities of 20th century liked to come for a cup of coffee and chat with friends and acquaintances. These places still exist and are open to all and every visitor who comes to the Village. Woody Allen, Andy Warhol, Valery Solanas, John Tyler, Jackson Pollock, Eugene O`Neill, Charlie Chaplin, Gregory Corso, Bob Dylan, Lawrence Ferlinghetti, Allen Ginsberg, LeRoi Jones, Jack Kerouac,Ray Bremser, Jimi Hendrix, Bruce Springsteen, The Velvet Underground, Cat Mother & the All Night Newsboys, Kool and the Gang, Peter, Paul & Mary,  Lenny Bruce, Joan Rivers and many more- feel like a part of New York Bohemia. There is no other place like New York. This tour will include the sample of authentic New York style food such as pizza, falafel, riceballs and more.

Washington Square

New York University

New York Authentic Food

Musicians memorable places

"Friends" Building

"Stonewall Inn" Riot and more

This tour takes approximately two hours and is easily accessible for baby strollers and wheelchairs.


The cost for this event is only $10. Please follow this link to make a payment:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/walk-and-eat-west-village-tour-tickets-17923454535

every 1st, 3rd, & 5th Sunday

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

BEGINNER AND INTERMEDIATE LESSONS: 6:00-6:45 PM

from 9/7-12/7, the intermediate lesson will be a performance class, see details below

---------------------------------------------------------------------------

-Featuring a wonderful mix of rotating DJs.

-Low cost, high fun at a nice venue

-Only $7 before 5:15 PM for more than 4 hours of dancing fun :-)

-2 Lessons: Basic & Intermediate at 6:00 PM

-Dance Party starts at 6:45 PM and goes 'till 12:00 AM

-$7 before 5:15 PM, $12 after

***************************************************************

------IMPORTANT ANNOUNCEMENT------From 9/7/14-12/7/14-----

In place of the intermediate class, we'll be offering an intermediate level routine and performance opportunity.

We will be teaching and cleaning the routine on 9/7, 9/21, 10/5, 10/19, 11/2, 11/16, 11/30

You will perform in the show on Sunday, December 7th.

There is NO CHARGE for the class!

All you need to do is pay for the admission to the dance and show up by 6:00 PM!

 

What YOU get out of this:

1) The opportunity to perform for a group of supportive dancers

2) The opportunity to learn, practice, and utilize skills that help you understand musicality, presentation, partnering, and phrasing.

3) A TON OF FUN

What We Need From YOU:

1) Just YOU - partner NOT required

2) The choreography will be taught over the first 5 sessions. You need to be in attendance at least 3 of the first 5 Sundays. You also need to attend the review sessions on the last two Sundays (11/16 & 11/30). So in total, of the 7 choreography sessions, you need to attend at least 5.

***************************************************************

All night drinks specials!

* $6 Sangria

* $16 1/2 Carafe of Sangria

* $5 Corona

* $2 Bottle of Water

 

LOCATION:

Dancesport

22 West 34th St, btw 5 & 6 Av

4th floor

Look forward to seeing you there!

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Pssssst: This dance is part of a collaboration of multiple dance styles using the same venue to offer different dance styles all at the same time. There's Bachata, Salsa, Zouk, Kizomba, and West Coast Swing all happening at the SAME place, at the SAME time, for the SAME price! So, you have the chance to check out FIVE different dances all for the price of 1!  The evening starts with a Bachata Lesson at 5:00 PM.  For More Information:  https://www.facebook.com/events/308507872585674/

Elegant and Fun! Celebrate "Tu B'av" Jewish Matchmaking day - If you are NOT interested in finding a match... come ANYWAY for a pleasant evening ! : )  $20 at the door if you register in advance.  call[masked] or sign up on this site.

Dinner - Pasta w/ Salads and Ice Cream Bar ... Live Music ( piano and singer) - for dancing ...old and new favorites- lots of love songs.... and a Hora too!

Elegance - Nate Tiffe, of "Nathan Mark Music" will sing and play the piano - cabaret style ... 

We can schmooze, listen or dance to his extensive repertoire of favorite classics - We will emphasize love songs ( NOT all slow!) because of our "Belated Jewish Matchmaking day" theme !

 Fun- We will have some ice breaker activities .... to help everyone have an enjoyable evening and meet as many people as possible!

 Nate will take requests - with DJ equipment nearby if needed! Come ready to have fun! : )

 Please see the website http://nathanmarkmusic.com - click on "media" and watch and listen to Nathan's rendition of some  favorites! 

This will be a great way to spend a summer evening! We can celebrate the last month of summer... and Jewish matchmaking day... 

Martine

THIS EVENT IS ALSO POSTED on the  NORTH JERSEY JEWISH SINGLES MEETUP GROUP MONTHLY EVENTS AT THE CLIFTON JEWISH CENTER - as well as other Meetup groups and various local newspapers

results.description:
Permit Disclosure: We have a permit

(Leader- Joanne)

New Rules: RoundRobin 3 teams of 4 players. Teams rotate every 10 minutes. Please bring a white shirt, a dark shirt(black,navy,dark grey) and a bright colored shirt(red,blue,yellow,orange,pink,green)

We'll have a dark team, white team and the colors team

Arrive on time 6:15pm!!! Late comers will wait on the sidelines to be placed in the game.

We start at 6:30pm.

4v4 small goals

Rules:

Fun Play
No Sliding
Goals after half point only.
kick-ins.. no throw ins.
Corner kicks.
Kick-off at midpoint after each goal.

To promote generosity, honor and respect, PS2G plays clean soccer!! This means No Cursing, Insulting, Complaining, Arguing or Fighting! We welcome you if this is your usual style and you want to change your attitude to fit our culture.

The fee is  $4 via paypal, The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

Bring indoor shoes or sneakers, Dark,colors and white shirt

Please be sure you are definitely showing up when RSVPing.
Refunds are only given when PS2G cancels a game. If the game is canceled, please go to this link <http://ps2g.org/games/refund-request>; for a refund.

There is a minimum of 3v3 with 6 RSVPs needed to have a game. Game will be cancelled if this number is not reached 1 hour before the game time. Check comments for updates from Game Leader.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G enables soccer players to organize fundraising pickup games that support our charity network ultimately promoting the safe play of soccer for disadvantaged children.

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

[masked]

FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

Making delicious macarons is a true art. The popularity of this French dessert has only exploded in the past few years. During this 2h 30min session, you will learn how to prepare, bake, and make this delightful and light pastry. Chef Simon will guide and teach you every step of the way in order for you to perfect the recipe behind this sophisticated delicacy. From whipping the meringue into the base to piping the shells onto a sheet and cooking an exquisite ganache, guests will acquire the essential techniques to be able to replicate the recipe at home. Sharpen your macaron cooking skills with Chef Simon! Book Now!


Book Now!

results.description:
We meet in the City every Sunday from 6:30-8:30pm on 48 Wall Street (5th Floor). Join the group and experience the authentic community you've been looking for. Get to know each other over food, live music, Bible study, and discussion.


Here are several things that characterize our weekly gatherings:

THINKING.
We curiously read and discuss the Bible (Hebrew & Greek Scriptures), asking questions, seeking out answers, and applying what we learn to our lives.

AUTHENTICITY.
Our community is made up of a group of authentic and openhearted believers that learn to care about and help each other.

MUSIC & THE ARTS.
We play fresh tunes through the sound system, and our stellar musicians often perform live music with inspirational and prayerful lyrics.

SOCIETY.
We invest time to strategize how to serve our neighbors and city through strategic, outward-focused activity.

It is important for us to be strong in our minds, hearts, and hands. We want to use our minds to study truth; we want to learn how to love God with our hearts; we want to use our hands to make our city a better place.
results.name: Sunday Gathering: Start Your Week Off Right

results.description:
Each week dozens of CRC members and friends gather following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity to socialize, network and connect.  It is a great way to meet others in the group in a fun and casual way.

This week we will be going to Firehouse Tavern who has donated to our charity events in the past.  Hang out at the bar and socialize or sit and have a bite to eat with the group, separate checks are no problem. 

Can I come alone?  Yes, Sunday is the best time to come on your own as almost everyone comes on their own.  Dave will be on hand to welcome everyone old and new.

Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity Parish? No many of our members belong to other parishes.

What if I went to the earlier mass?  Not a problem, come for the gathering and enjoy food and drink

The group will meet on the sidewalk after mass (approx 6:30pm) then walk over together or you can meet us at the restaurant.

Paul is the host for this Sunday.
results.name: After Mass Gathering at Firehouse Tavern

results.description:
CCCADI in partnership with Lincoln Center Out of Doors presents:

Ache: Lavagem da Rua

Featuring Gilson Menezes Santos Dorea (former lead singer of Araketo), Alexandre Cortes de Barros, a section of Baianas, members of the Afoxe of Filhas de Gandhy, drummers from Brazil, Something Positive from Trinidad, Legacy Circle from the Dominican Republic, Ashe Dance from Haiti, Amma McKen, and Grupo Oriefun from Cuba

Introduced to the United States by Silvana Magda, Lavagem de Rua is a sacred Brazilian tradition that translates as “the cleansing of streets.” African Diasporic tradition acknowledges the road as a metaphor for the journey of life. The Caribbean Cultural Center brings together artists representing countries of the diaspora including Brazil, Cuba, Trinidad, Haiti, Puerto Rico, and more to reflect the different roads of song, music, and dance travelled on the path to a joyful destiny. Ache—may it be so!


WHEN: Sunday, August 2, 2015 | 7pm
WHERE: Damrosch Park Bandshell | Amsterdam Ave. and W. 62 St., New York, NY 10023
ADMISSION: FREE!
results.name: ACHE!

group.name: African Art, Music and Culture in Brooklyn and Bey

results.description:
Hello lovely ladies,

Thanks to everyone who came out to the Cubby Hole the other night.  I wanted to write to suggest you use this MeetUp to schedule free events and outings (no pun intended) to meet other women who are new to the gay scene and in the process of coming out.  If you do schedule something, please be accountable for showing up and introducing everyone to each other, as I can't always make it.  Some suggested outings might include a picnic in the Sheep's Meadow, Bagels on the Promenade, a weekend brunch, gallery walk, or listing other lesbian MeetUps you don't want to attend one alone.  This is a great way to build a group of supportive friends.

Speaking of support, there is nothing better than a Lesbian Coming Out Group!  We already have one in full swing here in Cobble Hill, but check back to see if I'll be hosting one in the summer, or email me if you think you want to join one.  Another resource for you is a non-profit I volunteer for that has amazing groups.www.IdentityHouse.org.  They host lesbian, bi-sexual and transgender groups, so check it out. While therapy or one-on-one coachng is awesome during your time of transition, there is nothing that can beat a group of loving supportive peers when you're going through the coming out process.

Have a wonderful spring!

Jan
results.name: Post Events Here to Meet Other Women Who Are Coming Out

results.description:
Teams are 7v7, 90min+ game. 2 or 3 teams (depending on final numbers). We rotate every 10 min games. Arrive early and be ready to start on time. All players must bring a white and black t-shirt.


***********************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes or molded cleats. Proper Soccer attire only.

3) Played in a fun and chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated. Pass the ball have fun.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, players rotate in goal. Goals are 6' x 18'.


5) If you arrive late wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.

All players must RSVP, payment goes toward light rentals, field permits, equipment and fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

You'll need to update your RSVP 24 hours before the match, to receive a credit for the next game. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you at the pitch!

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.
results.name: Sunday Soccer 7v7 COED @7:00pm W. Village- 90min+

results.description:
Elegant and Fun!  Celebrate  "Tu B'av"  Jewish Matchmaking day - Better late than Never! 

Dinner - Pasta w/ Salad and  Ice Cream Bar ... Live Music ( piano and singer) - for dancing  ...old and new favorites-  lots of  love songs.... and a Hora too!

Elegance -  Nate Tiffe, of "Nathan Mark Music" will  sing and play the piano for us - cabaret style ...  We can schmooze,  listen or dance to his extensive repertoire of favorite classics - We will emphasize love songs because of our "Belated Jewish Matchmaking day" theme !  

Fun -  We will have some  ice breaker activities .... to help everyone have an enjoyable evening and meet as many people as possible!  

 Nate will take requests - with DJ equipment nearby if needed! 

 Come ready to have fun!  : ) 

Please see the website http://nathanmarkmusic.com - click on "media" and watch and listen to Nathan's rendition of some of our favorites!  

This will be a great way to spend a summer evening! 

We can celebrate the last month of summer... and Jewish matchmaking day... ( a little late but better late than never!)

I will keep you posted!

Martine
results.name: Live music and DJ- Belated Boomers "Tu B'av dance" - jewish matchmaking day

results.description:
Support Group Offering More than Just "Talk"

Come share about the effects of unhealthy relationships in your life.

We will also share and do role playing around about what a healthy relationship looks like and how we can begin to have a healthier relationship with ourselves.

There will be a meditation, sharing, educational readings, role playing and fun activities as well as support for each other.

This week's special-bring a friend get half off the session.

 Do you find yourself attracting people who are unavailable, incapable of treating you with the love and respect you deserve?

Do you have difficulties making healthy choices?

 Would you like to view your relationships in a new and different perspective?

Unhealthy relationships can be experienced with intimate partners as well as with friends, parents, siblings, children or work relationships. Meet others struggling with the same issues. Have fun, feel safe and supported while experiencing meditation, deep sharing, role-playing, educational readings and structured exercises.

 Group will meet 1-2x month on Sundays 7:15PM - 8:30PM, 25 Smith Street, Nanuet, NY  10954,

Introductory Rate $10 per Session, Facilitated by a Certified Addiction Recovery Coach, Certified Addiction Peer Advocate, Life Skills Coach and Independent Health Coach
results.how_to_find_us: side door facing Kohl's
results.name: Create Healthy Relationships and Let go of Unhealthy ones

results.description:
RSVPs open 3 days prior to event at 8pm.

This evening is Competitive Play (Intermediate/Advance). Perfect for those who want to step-up their game. 

Having less experienced players in the more intense Sunday night setting is both unsafe and unfair to the other attendees. But all are welcome to attend Friday nights. (Use your own judgement of skill level before signing up for Sunday) 

Players are expected to be able to handle free pass, pass accurately, and most important "BUMP SET SPIKE" with every effort not to just return the ball on the other side. Regular volleyball rules will be more closely enforced


Please RSVP only if you are 100% sure you can make it.  When you RSVP, you are holding a spot for a meetup that has high demand.  No refunds will be issued if you decide to cancel.  

Only players on the ACTIVE list will be allowed to play (No Exceptions).  If you must cancel, allow your spot to be given to someone on the wait list. 


RULES:

-Carrying will be called 

-Doubles will be called 

- NO REDOS on ANY ceiling obstacles

-No top Net touches

-No going under the net on the opposite side of the court. (Safety)

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

 This six week, progressive session will have 3 levels:


  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631564381

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=631567294

</a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. <a href="http://www.SwingRemix.com">www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">
