results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.

results.description:
This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

Every week we will have a different prompt for our weekly photo project.  This week’s theme is Water.

Each week beginning early Monday morning, you can begin uploading your photos to our meetup album for the week’s theme.  The group won’t actually meet for this event, it’s an individual online challenge for each of you to get your creative juices flowing, share photos in the group, comment and critique each other’s shots, and above all have fun. 

Albums will remain open, so you can upload photos any time after that Monday morning start time but you’ll get the most feedback during the initial week the theme is posted.  You also don’t have to restrict yourself to photos taken during that week for the theme, they can be from past shoots you have done or the weekly prompt can be used to motivate you to shoot something new.

results.description:
What is coffee chat?

#CoffeeChat is a time for us to meet while we're on your way to work in the morning or just about to get your day started. We come together for about an hour to share stories and find some common conversation with other people who are working to make positive things happen.

Over the years of attending #CoffeeChat events, we see that people have continued to come together; it's a little bit of networking and a little bit of inspiration. I hope wherever you are you will consider organizing your own morning meetup with like-minded (or different-minded!) people in your community.

When you raise the flag, and let people know what you are interested in (especially if that interest involves bringing like minded people together) you are well on your way to making a positive difference and a significant impact on your local community.

And, if you do schedule a coffee chat, please do let us know; we'll post the event here! I look forward to getting to spend more time with you and the community you surround yourself.

Jason

PS: (the hashtag is how we promote on Instagram, Twitter, etc: #CoffeeChat)

PLEASE NOTE: IT IS NOT ENOUGH TO JUST RSVP TO THIS OPPORTUNITY ON MEETUP- YOU MUST FILL OUT THE FORM BELOW AND RECEIVE CONFIRMATION.  PLEASE SO NOT SHOW UP WITHOUT CONFIRMATION. 


 Seeking volunteers to  assist in activities and engage and stimulate the members of the CARE program (Center for Alzheimer's Respite Care for the Elderly), which enhances the well-being and emotional health of mentally frail older adults, including persons with Alzheimer's disease or related dementia. This is a daytime program full of music, arts and crafts, and yoga.  We are looking for volunteers on the August 3, August 10, August 17, between 9:30-2:30. 

Volunteer with Lenox Hill Neighborhood House during the month of August! Lenox Hill Neighborhood House, widely recognized as one of New York’s premier nonprofit organizations, is a 121-year-old settlement house that provides an extensive array of effective and integrated human services—social, educational, legal, health, housing, mental health, nutritional and fitness—which significantly improve the lives of 20,000 people in need each year, ages 3 to 103, on the East Side of Manhattan. At the Help Network (https://www.facebook.com/TheHelpNetwork?fref=ts) ;, we try to recruit volunteers who commit to spend a minimum of one hour per week assisting a disabled, elderly, or sick person. We are looking for volunteers to assist at Lenox Hill Neighborhood House throughout the month of August, as well as committing to spend a minimum of one hour per week assisting a disabled, elderly, or sick person in the future.

Priority goes to those who can volunteer from 9:30-2:30 on all three requested days: August 3, August 10, August 17. Please select a box for each day you are able to volunteer.


If you are able to help, please sign up here:
https://docs.google.com/forms/d/16OGB3fwHeS19GvjUdF-x20a6Ce4aGZSqbaLU9QHBk2g/edit
results.name: Volunteer Series with Lenox Hill Neighborhood House!

results.description:
"It was deep it was soulful, it was techno, it was disco, a kaleidoscope of sounds, it was truly underground. It was an essential mix in the cloud where we could dance and sing out loud. It was New York, Ibiza and Miami all wrapped up into one. There were speakers the size of skyscrapers and the stars they flickered like strobes, and everybody loved everybody else...I must have went to house heaven, because nothing’s that divine."                                                       

—Roland Clark

That’s right, we’re calling on all our DJ's to contribute for our weekly radio shows broadcast www.soundboxonline.com. What better way to keep those decks moving and keeping them from stagnating by pooling the tracks that tickle your fancy and inspire you as a DJ.


A mix is a great way to showcase your talent, the tracks that get you bumping and the tracks that have inspired you on the path of DJ-ing. So think of the bedroom as your house of worship. Honor it, pay reverence to it and give us a damn good mix worthy of the pantheon of the DJ gods on Mt. Olympus. 


Some common ground rules to ensure a quality mix and ensure serious commitment:

•  House, deep-house, tech-house, techno, minimal, EDM or any other genre that fits into the house category.


• High quality mp3/wav 320kbps. 

• Record a 1 hour mix without peaks, in other words; no clipping!


• Transitions need to be well segued, near flawless

• Sample mix required to ensure DJ commitment and whether or not you make the cut for the radio show


• A great profile pic


So once you’ve ticked all these off the list, you’re on your way to getting your DJ mix broadcasted. We’re especially reaching out to our new and beginning DJ's looking to make their mark. Send us a link where we can download your mix. Also send us a picture, so we can add it to the visual in case your mix has been selected for the weekly broadcast. Looking forward to hearing some great mixes.


Ayelmer Veenstra --- LMR

A.D.G. 

~ pls. send the visual and the link to (download) your mix to: [masked]

Classes are created for those with physical disabilities, aliments, recovering from surgery, Seniors OR who are seeking a gentle practice to restore the body and mind.
Classes will include poses and methods that will allow students to increase muscular strength, endurance, flexibility as well as stamina, lung capacity and overall wellness. While experiencing the positive effects Yoga has on the mind-body connection. We will practice our asana's (postures) with the use of a chair. Students can either remain seated through the session or stand and use the back of the chair while standing. Asana's are expressed both ways,so the student can find the expression that works best for their needs.

Postures are modified into variations designed to fit each individuals needs.
Classes will be held in an atmosphere that is extraordinary, surrounded by beautiful stain glass windows inside the actual church. That will complement the tranquility and peace of our practice.These classes have no bearing on religious beliefs and are open to all.
Please join me at The All Saints Episcopal Church 2329 Victory Blvd. Staten Island, N.Y. 10314.

Mondays and Fridays 11:00 am.

results.description:
Greenwich Village in Manhattan is a community with a global history and reputation. The quiet streets of the area have been the stage for creative and social movements that today give shape to the unique American character. The area started out as farm territory and later became an immigrant community. In the first half of the 20th century the area was inhabited by some of the greatest creative minds of American Culture. Today the area retains it’s cultural essence in diverse aspects and it’s public art and architecture contrast richly with the greater metropolitan environment of NYC.

Itenerary:
• Father Demo Square
• Bleecker Street
• Cherry Lane Theater
• Sheridan Square
• Cafe Wha?
• Washington Square Park
• New York University
• And Much More

Reservations: 
Please RSVP.If you later realize you will not be able to attend please change your reservation.

Where:
Participants meet with the guide ten minutes before tour begins at father Demo Square on 6th Av. and Bleecker St. map here. Tour concludes at Washington Square Park map here.

Cost: 
This tour has a market value of $20 per person. You do not have to pay this. Your guide is compensated with your gratuities. Monetary contributions are collected anonymously at the end. Other great ways you can contribute are by reviewing the walk and referring it to other people.

Some of the Sights we will experience:

results.name: The Art and Culture of Greenwich Village

results.description:
Our twice-monthly meeting of business professionals takes place from 4pm - 5pm in a private meeting room at the restaurant.

While there are many ways to make connections with potential new clients, nothing is better than having that prospect's trusted advisor pick up a phone or send an e-mail that says, "Here's someone you need to speak with about that problem you're having".  This is exactly what the members of Smart Transition Group do for each other.  We get to know each other, we get to trust each other, and then we share our most valuable resource... our clients.  

We all want to grow our businesses, but doing it personally, face-to-face, with people you trust and appreciate, makes it faster, easier, and far more effective.  Come learn more as a guest of the group at one of our upcoming meetings.  Bring your best-self, and a stack of business cards.

We'll take an opportunity to introduce ourselves and get to know other members. We will often have a featured member who will expand on the details of their business and help us to understand their buying signs so that we know who to think of when we hear them from our clients.

After a good discussion and a recap of the progress we will retire to the bar at Morton's for a drink and a more relaxed discussion. Some say, that's where the business really happens.

This is a great way to spend some time on a Monday afternoon growing your network and building alliances.
results.name: Monday Meetings at Morton's (The Steakhouse)

group.name: Smart Transition Group - Business Networking that Works

results.description:
David Negrin, executive director and head instructor of the NYC Screenwriters Collective discusses the craft of screenwriting, the current state of the business of writing for television and film, and the NYC Screenwriters Collective’s unique approach to script analysis and development. 

David Negrin is a screenwriter, producer, and professor of film and television at Hofstra University. He is Executive Director of the NYC Screenwriters Collective, the largest non-profit screenwriting workshop in New York City. He is also Host of 'The Script' Podcast and moderator of @ScriptFeed. He grew up in New York City and is an alumnus of The Bronx High School of Science.

This seminar will be two (2) sessions of ninety (90) minutes each

Adorama is located at 42 West 18th Street, NYC. We're just a short walk from Union Square or the 6th Avenue - 14th Street subway station.
results.name: SEMINAR: "NYC Screenwriters Collective - The Collective Method"

results.description:
Meet at 5:00 pm.

Ride at 5:15 pm

IF TIME IS NO GOOD, PLEASE POST WHEN YOU CAN BE HERE.    I will adjust start time as needed.

Meet at small parking lot off of College Road (University Drive.)

Intro to High Mountain.   If you ever wanted to give it a try at a nice slow, no pressure pace, and you've mastered most of the beginner rides, this ride is for you.

High Mt is a technical park, which is a great place to work on skills.  There will be stopping and walking.  No drop.

No ride to the top.  4 - 5 miles

Map of Park: http://www.wpunj.edu/dotAsset/325914.pdf

Park Website: http://www.nynjtc.org/park/high-mountain-park-preserve

A description from mtbNJ "with lots of loose rock, and rock garden too and lots of climbing, lessflowy trails hence the rocks. This trails will make you love or hate High Mountain. There's some nice single track too."

Note:  Can get there from Hamburg Tpk in Wayne to University Drive  at a light (Turn left) or

From 287 to Route 208 S, Take Ewing Ave Exit and travel S to T (stop sign), Turn L onto High Mt Road.  Stay on High Mt Road to fork, keep right to stay on High Mt Road.   At next traffic light, make a right.  At stop sign, this is College Road, turn right.  Parking lot is up a ways on the right.

Join Nafisa Sharriff and the West African Dance Family for Free Classes every Monday and Wednesday evening at Countee Cullen/PS 194. Countee Cullen is located on 144th Street between Adam Clayton Powell and Frederick Douglas Blvds in Harlem, NY. Summer Hours: 5pm – 7pm (July and August only).

Nafisa Sharriff is a Master Teacher and Choreographer of Traditional West African Folklore from the Old Malian Empire. She is the recipient of the 1996 Ethnic Dance Award and numerous Community Service commemorations. Throughout her illustrious career Nafisa performed with Stevie Wonder, Whitney Houston, Spike Lee, TC Carson, C&C Music Factory, The Chuck Davis Dance Company & The Kairaba West African Dance Company. Her television credits include performances on the Richard Pryor Show, Dance Black America & Positively Black.

results.description:
Image Credit: Museum of The City of New York

Join #drinkingaboutmuseums #NYC for a special tour of the exhibition #FolkCity at the Museum of the City of New York (@MuseumofCityNY) on Monday, August 3, 2015. Enter the museum at the main entrance on Fifth Avenue. 

The Museum of the City of New York celebrates and interprets the city, educating the public about its distinctive character, especially its heritage of diversity, opportunity, and perpetual transformation. 

The exhibition "Folk City: New York and The Folk Music Revival" traces the roots of the folk music revival in New York City during the 1950s and 1960s. 


The group will be welcomed by Renae Mason (@missnae) and Susan Johnson (@Museumgoing). Curator of "Folk City" and co-author of a publication of the same name, Stephen Petrus, will lead the hour tour. 

After the tour, we will walk over to The Gutherie Inn for refreshment at this aptly named location. The Gutherie Inn is at 1259 Park Ave, New York, NY 10029 between 97th and 98th Streets.


RSVP via Meetup. Open to 25 RSVPs. Tweet Neal Stimler (@nealstimler) and contact me with your questions or concerns. Please share the event details on Twitter and your other favorite social networks. 

Schedule:

Tour of "Folk City" at The Museum of City of New York
5:30PM-6:30PM

Drinking at The Gutherie Inn
6:30PM-8:00PM

results.description:
45 minutes of diving into the teachings, techniques, and practice of Meditation, for new and experienced Meditators.

All meditations are meant to purify our heart and bring our mind to its natural condition. Our consciousness is inherently pure, eternal, full of knowledge and bliss. But somehow or other it has been covered by and adulterated by so many misconceptions, so many desires, so many longings, so many anxieties about what we want and what we don’t want. 

When you look into a mirror, you see yourself. But what if that mirror has been neglected for hundreds of years? There are layers and layers of debris, dust, dirt and filth. And when you look into that mirror, all you see is the dust and the dirt that is accumulated, and all that you think is “This is me!” But when you clean the mirror, little by little you start seeing the image of yourself. And when the mirror is actually clean, you see who you are. Meditation is for that purpose; prayers are for that purpose; spirituality is for that purpose: to cleanse our heart, to cleanse our life-style so that we can actually directly experience our own essence, which is eternal, full of knowledge and full of love
results.name: Let's meet up and Meditate

results.description:
Come for the sheer joy of moving to the music, in a nurturing and supportive setting.

Whether you have never danced before or want to continue, this is a class for you.

The classes are one hour and half in length and provide quality instruction.

Ballet is one of the most healthy and intense forms of dance.
It can provide a complete full-body workout, increasing your flexibility, range of motion and strength.

It’s also a great alternative to aerobics.

The classes are on-going, join in anytime.

PRICES Walk-Ins: $20.
Package: $180 for a card of 10 classes (over a course of 6 months).
Talk to us about multiple class per week discount!

ABOUT THE INSTRUCTOR
Bruce Weitzmon is a choreographer, dancer and teacher. His work has been presented in the U.S.A. and Canada. Bruce was the director of the Theater Dance Center, a non-profit dance education and performance organization in Rockland County, founded in 1981. After many years directing TDC, he returned to New York City to teach. Now after more than 10 years there, he is returning to offer a weekly schedule of classes in Nyack, NY.

VISIT US ON FACEBOOK
For more about the Dancers’ Art class schedule, rates or any additional information please visit and like Dancers’ Art on Facebook at www.facebook.com/DancersArt or call[masked]-1973.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
